prime_award_base_transaction_description: Developing a PRogram to Educate and Sensitize Caregivers to Reduce the Inappropriate Prescription Burden in Elderly with Alzheimer's Disease Study (D-PRESCRIBE-AD) - PROJECT SUMMARY/ABSTRACT Potentially inappropriate prescribing includes the use of medications that may no longer be necessary or that may increase the risk of harm. Inappropriate prescribing is a “morbidity multiplier,” increasing overall symptom burden, and adversely affecting health-related quality of life and function. Inappropriate prescribing of certain drug categories such as sedative/hypnotics, antipsychotics, highly anticholinergic agents, and certain oral hypoglycemic medications poses particular risks for older adults, and may be more prevalent among those with Alzheimer’s disease and Alzheimer’s disease-related dementias (AD/ADRD) due to a higher prevalence of multimorbidity and associated polypharmacy. The Developing a PRogram to Educate and Sensitize Caregivers to Reduce the Inappropriate Prescription Burden in Elderly with Alzheimer’s Disease Study (D-PRESCRIBE- AD) will test a health plan-based intervention leveraging the NIH Collaboratory's Distributed Research Network, which uses the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) Sentinel Initiative infrastructure. The overarching goal of our proposal is to develop, implement, and evaluate the effect of a patient/caregiver-centered, multifaceted educational intervention on inappropriate prescribing in patients with AD/ADRD. Our research hypothesis is that education on inappropriate prescribing among patients/caregivers and their providers can reduce medication-related morbidity in patients with AD/ADRD and lead to an improvement in medication safety for this vulnerable population. Our study population will include community-dwelling patients with AD/ADRD, identified based on a diagnosis of AD/ADRD or use of a medication for Alzheimer’s Disease, who have evidence of inappropriate prescribing. We will evaluate the effect of educational interventions designed to stimulate patient/caregiver-provider communication about medication safety (versus usual care) on the proportion of patients with inappropriate prescribing, the primary outcome of this study. The trial will be health plan-based, conducted in two large, national health plans. The study design will be a prospective, cluster randomized, comparative effectiveness intervention trial with three arms: (1) a combined patient/caregiver and provider educational intervention; (2) a provider only educational intervention; and (3) usual care. A one-year R61 planning phase will precede a four-year R33 implementation phase. During the R33 phase we will sequentially implement two separate pragmatic trials, each enrolling over 11,000 patients, adapting the second trial based on the findings and experience gained in the first. The R33 aims are: (1) to assess the impact of the patient/caregiver educational intervention on inappropriate prescribing to AD/ADRD patients, employing a prospective, cluster randomized trial design with three arms; and (2) to create a plan for disseminating study findings to stakeholders who might implement the intervention or make decisions about its future use. The proposed study is feasible because our partners include two large, national health plans, we will leverage an existing FDA Sentinel infrastructure, and we have a strong, multidisciplinary research team.
subaward_description:
HARVARD PILGRIM HEALTH CARE (HPHC) WILL CONDUCT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES AS AN ACTIVE PARTICIPANT IN THE
D-PRESCRIBE-AD STUDY. HPHC WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SAS PROGRAMMING, QUERY FULFILMENT (DISTRIBUTIONS OF SAS
PROGRAMS/"WORKPLANS", AND AGGREGATION OF RESULTS), AND SUPPORT RELATED TO THE SENTINEL COMMON DATA MODEL (SCDM)
AND TECHNICAL INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDED FOR THESE ACTIVITIES.
HPHC WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL EXPERTISE IN PHARMACOEPIDEMIOLOGY AND DATA SCIENCE NEEDED TO SUPPORT THE PROPOSED WORK
AND THE RELATED SECURE INFRASTRUCTURE TO CONDUCT QUERYING ACTIVITIES. HPHC WILL MAINTAIN FISMA-COMPLIANT SECURE FILE
SHARING AND QUERYING INFRASTRUCTURE, AND COORDINATE QUERYING ACTIVITIES. HPHC WILL COLLABORATE WITH STUDY LEAD AND HEALTH
PLAN LEADERSHIP, INVESTIGATORS, AND STAFF FROM THE DATA PARTNERS (DPS) TO DEVELOP AN INTERVENTIONAL STUDY PROTOCOL.
QUERYING WILL BE CONDUCTED IN A DISTRIBUTED APPROACH, ALLOWING DPS TO MAINTAIN PHYSICAL AND OPERATIONAL CONTROL OF THEIR
DATA. THIS APPROACH ALLOWS A COMPLEX ANALYTIC PROGRAM (E.G., A SAS PROGRAM USED TO IDENTIFY COHORTS) TO BE SECURELY
DISTRIBUTED TO ALL PARTNERS FOR EXECUTION BEHIND THEIR FIREWALLS WITHOUT MODIFICATION. RESULTS ARE REVIEWED LOCALLY AND
SECURELY AND RETURNED TO HPHC FOR ANALYSIS AND REPORTING. THIS STUDY WILL LEVERAGE THE SCDM. ALL DATA PARTNERS ARE
PARTICIPANTS OF THE FDA SENTINEL PROJECT AND WILL USE THEIR APPROVED LOCAL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SENTINEL COM FOR
QUERYING.

QUERYING WILL BE CONDUCTED IN A DISTRIBUTED APPROACH, ALLOWING DPS TO MAINTAIN PHYSICAL AND OPERATIONAL CONTROL OF THEIR
DATA. THIS APPROACH ALLOWS A COMPLEX ANALYTIC PROGRAM (E.G., A SAS PROGRAM USED TO IDENTIFY COHORTS) TO BE SECURELY
DISTRIBUTED TO ALL PARTNERS FOR EXECUTION BEHIND THEIR FIREWALLS WITHOUT MODIFICATION. RESULTS ARE REVIEWED LOCALLY AND
SECURELY AND RETURNED TO HPHC FOR ANALYSIS AND REPORTING. THIS STUDY WILL LEVERAGE THE SCDM. ALL DATA PARTNERS ARE
PARTICIPANTS OF THE FDA SENTINEL PROJECT AND WILL USE THEIR APPROVED LOCAL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SENTINEL COM FOR
QUERYING.

subaward_description: THE CITY OF ARLINGTON'S PUBLIC SAFETY CYBERSECURITY PROJECT WILL FUND THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF TWO FIREWALL APPARATUS FOR THE CITY OF ARLINGTON'S INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY DEPARTMENT TO IMPROVE CYBERSECURITY FOR PUBLIC SAFETY. THESE DEVICES WILL REPLACE EXISTING FIREWALL EQUIPMENT AT THE PRIMARY AND BACKUP SITES WITH TECHNOLOGY THAT WILL PROVIDE THE CITY GREATER LEVELS OF SECURITY TO PUBLIC SAFETY.

prime_award_program_activities_funding_t: 0001: CAS - GRANTS;OPTN: FIELD IS OPTIONAL PRIOR TO FY21
subaward_description: THE CITY OF HUNTSVILLE CYBERSECURITY SOFTWARE SOLUTION PROJECT WILL PURCHASE CYBER SECURITY SOFTWARE FOR THE PROTECTION OF THE HUNTSVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL IT NETWORK. THIS SECURITY SOFTWARE AS A SERVICE (SAAS) SOLUTION WILL BE USED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE CURRENT NETWORK ANTIVIRUS SOLUTION TO REINFORCE ANY FIREWALLS IDENTIFIED WITH VULNERABILITY GAPS WHICH CAN SERVE AS AN INFILTRATION POINT FOR CYBER ATTACKS

prime_award_base_transaction_description: The violent crime rate in Texas, since the end of the COVID-19 pandemic, has continued to slowly decrease over the past couple years with a 2% decrease seen in violent crime offenses in 2022 which is an improvement from the 1% decrease seen from 2020 to 2021. Despite the positive downward trend seen with violent crime, there has been an uptick in the number of property crimes that have occurred in the state with a 9% increase in property crime offenses in 2022. Of the total 817,637 index offenses committed in 2022, property crimes accounted for 84% of those crimes. The Legislative Budget Board stated in their Statewide Criminal and Juvenile Justice Recidivism and Revocation Rates report in February 2023 that, regarding individuals released from a prison or state jail facility in fiscal years 2018 and 2019 that were rearrested within three years of their release or start of supervision, the most prevalent type of offense for which individuals were rearrested was a drug offense and the most prevalent type of offense for which individuals were reincarcerated was a drug or property offense. The Texas Office of the Governors Public Safety Office (PSO) proposes to use its FY2023 Byrne JAG funds to further support the reduction of crime and making Texas a safer place which includes helping victims of crime recover and feel safe again while building trust within the communities with local law enforcement. Grant funds may be used to provide additional law enforcement and court personnel, specialized equipment and training for law enforcement, officer wellness programs, pre-trial diversion programs, jail or prison-based treatment programs, reentry programs, community policing and community-based violence prevention programs, and specialized software and training for court and correctional personnel. PSO anticipates the outcome of this funding will result in a reduction in crime, violence, and recidivism.

subaward_description:
ELISE TOWNSEND WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR DESIGNING AND MANAGING PHYSICAL THERAPY ASSESSMENTS OF SUBJECTS AT THE MGH NEUROLOGICAL
CLINICAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE (NCRI). MANAGEMENT OF PHYSICAL THERAPY ASSESSMENTS WILL INCLUDE TRAINING PRIMARY EVALUATOR(S) TO PERFORM
TESTS OF MUSCLE FUNCTION, RELIABILITY TRAINING, ASSESSMENT AND RE-TRAINING, SCORING OF TESTS, DATA REVIEW AND DATA ENTRY INTO A SECURE
DATABASE BEHIND THE MGH FIREWALL THAT WILL BE ACCESSIBLE TO OVERALL STUDY PI DR. WHEELER, BIOSTATISTICIAN CO-INVESTIGATOR DR. DAS, AND
THE STUDY COORDINATOR AT MGH. RESPONSIBILITIES WILL ALSO INCLUDE SERVING AS A BACK UP PT EVALUATOR, COLLABORATING WITH THE PI AND
BIOSTATISTICIAN FOR INTERPRETATION OF MOTOR OUTCOME TEST RESULTS, AND WRITING/EDITING MANUSCRIPTS OR MANUSCRIPT SECTIONS RELATED TO TESTS OF
MUSCLE FUNCTION.

subaward_description:
THE PURPOSE OF THE RESEARCH IS TO ALLOW COLLABORATION IN CHARACTERIZING PHYSIOLOGIC AND
PATHOPHYSIOLOGIC SIGNATURES OF ILLNESS IN MONITORED PATIENTS, AND TO DEVELOP VALIDATED
MATHEMATICAL AND STATISTICAL PREDICTIVE MODELS THAT ASSIST CLINICIANS IN EARLY DETECTION OF SUBACUTE
POTENTIALLY CATASTROPHIC ILLNESSES.
COLUMBIA WILL PROVIDE TO VIRGINIA COMPUTER FILES CONTAINING DEIDENTIFIED DATA FOR HUMAN
SUBJECTS RESEARCH AND QUALITY IMPROVEMENT. THE DATA INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO CLINICAL
INFO1MATION SUCH AS LABORATORY RESULTS AND BEDSIDE MONITOR INFORMATION SUCH AS DIGITIZED
WAVEFORMS, VITAL SIGNS, AND VENTILATOR READINGS. THE DATA WILL BE PROVIDED IN AN OPEN BINARY
FORMAT BUT WILL NOT INCLUDE HIP AA IDENTIFIERS. PATIENTS AND DATA WILL BE IDENTIFIED USING ONLY
S_TUDY NUMBERS AND CODED TIMESTAMPS. THE LINK-CODING TABLE WILL BE HELD SECURELY AT THE SITE
COLLECTING THE DATA, AND WILL NOT BE SHARED. COLUMBIA WILL ALSO PROVIDE TO VIRGINIA
ALGORITHMS FOR ANALYSIS OF THESE DATA, AND HEREBY GRANTS TO VIRGINIA A NON-EXCLUSIVE, PERPETUAL,
PAID-UP, ROYALTY-FREE LICENSE TO INSTALL, OPERATE AND USE THEIR ANALYSIS ROUTINES.
VIRGINIA WILL PROVIDE TO COLUMBIA COMPUTER FILES CONTAINING DEIDENTIFIED DATA FOR HUMAN
SUBJECTS RESEARCH AND QUALITY IMPROVEMENT. THE DATA INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO CLINICAL
INFORMATION SUCH AS LABORATORY RESULTS AND BEDSIDE MONITOR INFORMATION SUCH AS DIGITIZED
WAVEFORMS, VITAL SIGNS, AND VENTILATOR READINGS. THE DATA WILL BE PROVIDED IN AN OPEN BINARY
FORMAT BUT WILL NOT INCLUDE HIP AA IDENTIFIERS. PATIENTS AND DATA WILL BE IDENTIFIED USING ONLY
STUDY NUMBERS AND CODED TIMESTAMPS. THE LINK-CODING TABLE WILL BE HELD SECURELY AT THE SITE
COLLECTING THE DATA, AND WILL NOT BE SHARED. VIRGINIA WILL ALSO PROVIDE TO COLUMBIA
ALGORITHMS FOR ANALYSIS OF THESE DATA, AND HEREBY GRANTS TO COLUTV;T:BIA A NON-EXCLUSIVE,
PERPETUAL, PAID~UP, ROYALTY-FREE LICENSE TO INSTALL, OPERATE AND USE THEIR ANALYSIS ROUTINES.
THE RESEARCH PLAN WILL BE TO ANALYZE THESE DATA UNDER RESEARCH AND DATABASE PROTOCOLS APPROVED
BY EACH SITE'S IRB AND USING CLINICALLY-SECURE FIREWALL-PROTECTED COMPUTERS.

O FIND LINK BETWEEN CONSORTIA. IF AGREED WITH FEND-TB LEADERSHIP TEAM, FIND WILL SUPPORT R2D2 TB NETWORK AND FEND TB PIS AND LEAD COORDINATED INTERACTIONS BETWEEN JERRY AND ADITHYA, E.G. O FIND BIOREPOSITORY. FIND WILL MAKE THE SAMPLE BANK AVAILABLE AND WAIVE THE FEES.

subawardee_business_types: OTHER NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
DR. SHAUN GRANNIS, INDIANA UNIVERSITY, WORKING WITH THE REGENSTRIEF INSTITUTE WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL AND SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE FOR THE PROJECT. TOGETHER, THEY WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTAINING THE INFRASTRUCTURE FOR IDENTIFYING AND FILTERING PATHOLOGY, CLINICAL, AND DIAGNOSTIC RADIOLOGY REPORTS FROM INDIANAÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S HIE FOR ROUTING TO THE KCR. 
THIS WILL REQUIRE CONTINUING INPUT FROM SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS (SMES) AT KCR FOR GUIDANCE ON THE RULES FOR EXTRACTING THE CORRECT REPORTS FROM THE HIE. THEY WILL ALSO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTAINING THE PATHWAY FOR ROUTING THE IDENTIFIED REPORTS FROM THE INITIAL EXTRACT THROUGH DMZS, FIREWALLS, ETC TO THE FINAL INTERFACE THAT BRIDGES THE INPC AND KCR. 
REGENSTRIEF WILL COLLABORATE WITH CO-INVESTIGATORS AND STAFF AT THE KCR TO DEVELOP NEW FILTERING TECHNIQUES FOCUSED ON DIAGNOSTIC RADIOLOGY REPORTS. REGENSTRIEF WILL SHARE LESSONS, PROCESSES, TECHNIQUES, AND SOFTWARE DEVELOPED UNDER THE AUSPICES OF THIS GRANT WITH THE COLLABORATION TEAM, THE CDC, AND OTHER STATE REGISTRIES. 
PUBLICATIONS, REPORTS, ETC. ARE ALSO VERY NORMAL WORK PRODUCTS FOR REGENSTRIEF AND THEY WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THOSE AND TAKE THE LEAD ON SOME AS THE PROJECT UNFOLDS.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: ENHANCING CANCER REGISTRIES FOR EARLY CASE CAPTURE
prime_award_cfda_numbers_and_titles: 93.283: CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION INVESTIGATIONS AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE; 93.283: THE AFFORDABLE CARE ACT:  CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION_INVESTIGATIONS AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE; 93.283: THE AFFORDABLE CARE ACT: CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION_INVEST
subawardee_business_types: OTHER NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
DR. SHAUN GRANNIS, INDIANA UNIVERSITY, WORKING WITH THE REGENSTRIEF INSTITUTE WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL AND SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE FOR THE PROJECT. TOGETHER, THEY WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTAINING THE INFRASTRUCTURE FOR IDENTIFYING AND FILTERING PATHOLOGY, CLINICAL, AND DIAGNOSTIC RADIOLOGY REPORTS FROM INDIANAÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S HIE FOR ROUTING TO THE KCR. 
THIS WILL REQUIRE CONTINUING INPUT FROM SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS (SMES) AT KCR FOR GUIDANCE ON THE RULES FOR EXTRACTING THE CORRECT REPORTS FROM THE HIE. THEY WILL ALSO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTAINING THE PATHWAY FOR ROUTING THE IDENTIFIED REPORTS FROM THE INITIAL EXTRACT THROUGH DMZS, FIREWALLS, ETC TO THE FINAL INTERFACE THAT BRIDGES THE INPC AND KCR. 
REGENSTRIEF WILL COLLABORATE WITH CO-INVESTIGATORS AND STAFF AT THE KCR TO DEVELOP NEW FILTERING TECHNIQUES FOCUSED ON DIAGNOSTIC RADIOLOGY REPORTS. REGENSTRIEF WILL SHARE LESSONS, PROCESSES, TECHNIQUES, AND SOFTWARE DEVELOPED UNDER THE AUSPICES OF THIS GRANT WITH THE COLLABORATION TEAM, THE CDC, AND OTHER STATE REGISTRIES. 
PUBLICATIONS, REPORTS, ETC. ARE ALSO VERY NORMAL WORK PRODUCTS FOR REGENSTRIEF AND THEY WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THOSE AND TAKE THE LEAD ON SOME AS THE PROJECT UNFOLDS.

prime_awardee_business_types: Nonprofit with 501C3 IRS Status (Other than an Institution of Higher Education)
prime_award_base_transaction_description: Adult Changes in Thought (ACT) Research Program - The Adult Changes in Thought (ACT) U19 Program will expand, modernize, and improve ACT's prospective cohort study to achieve advances in scientific understanding of older adults in general and dementia and Alzheimer's disease in particular. ACT is set in a healthcare delivery system. The study team identifies incident cases of dementia and Alzheimer's disease and follows consenting participants to autopsy. The Program will transform the current ACT U01 to a U19, which envisions complex multi-component programs that will have a powerful influence on the field. The Program's overarching goal is to identify risk factors across the life course that provide potential intervention targets for preserving cognition and preventing Alzheimer's disease and related dementias (ADRD). The Overall Specific Aims are: Aim 1. Expand ACT cohort enrollment and modernize and improve follow-up with emphasis on increasing racial/ethnic diversity and deep phenotyping of life course risk factors, cognitive and physical functioning, and outcomes including neuroimaging and neuropathology based ADRD outcomes. The Cores will expand cohort enrollment from 2,000 to 3,000. The study will invest in six Cores: A, Administrative; B, Clinical; C, Life Course; D, Neuropathology; E, Neuroimaging; F, Data and Analysis. These Cores will work together to further enhance the value of ACT's resources, enabling the ACT study to continue to be the foundation for an extraordinary array of science. To date, ACT has achieved a completeness of follow-up index of 94.5% and has observed 56,140 person-years of follow-up. ACT has identified >1,300 incident dementia cases and >1,000 incident Alzheimer's cases. The study has completed >850 autopsies and will surpass 1,100 autopsies this cycle. Additionally, 1,077 ACT participants had one MRI scan, and 540 have had =2, with funding in place for hundreds more. Aim 2. Support key Projects studying the spectrum of healthy functioning to ADRD in older adults. The three Projects center around 24-hour cycle physical activity, sedentary behavior, and sleep patterns in old age (Project 1), the implications of cognitively defined Alzheimer's disease subgroups (Project 2), and mechanisms underlying neural protection and toxicity of strong anticholinergic drugs and antihypertensive drugs (Project 3). Aim 3. Expand and improve ACT's dissemination of exceptional resources to the research community guided by NIA's adopted FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reproducible) principles. ACT has proven to be an exceptional resource to the research community, providing data and specimens to research colleagues locally, across the country, and around the world, and provides mentorship to junior investigators. We will continue to enhance our data sharing capabilities in this U19 Program.
subawardee_business_types: U.S. LOCAL GOVERNMENT,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
"THE UW - OFF CAMPUS DATA AND ANALYSIS CORE PROJECT TEAM WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THESE AIMS BY PARTICIPATING IN THE FOLLOWING ONGOING ACTIVITIES:

ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ WITH CLOSE CONSULTATION WITH KPWHRI DATA AND ANALYSIS CORE LEADERSHIP, PERFORM DATA ENTRY AND QUALITY CONTROL FOR DATA COLLECTED FROM ACT STUDY PARTICIPANTS ACCORDING TO STANDARDIZED PROCEDURES. DATA IS ENTERED INTO SECURELY STORED RAW DATA FILES AT UW AND SECURELY TRANSFERRED BEHIND THE KPWHRI FIREWALL VIA REMOTE DESKTOP APPLICATION OR VIA SECURE FILE TRANSFER (SFT) PROTOCOLS"

prime_award_cfda_numbers_and_titles: 93.837: CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASES RESEARCH; 93.839: BLOOD DISEASES AND RESOURCES RESEARCH
subawardee_business_types: PRIVATE UNIVERSITY OR COLLEGE,NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description:
DRS. STEVEN BELKNAP AND DENNIS WEST AT NORTHWESTERN UNIVERSITY WILL HELP THE DEVELOPMENT OF ADE ANNOTATION
GUIDELINE AND SERVE AS A TIE BREAKER FOR THE ADE ANNOTATION. THIS WORK WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED OVER A PERIOD OF 2
YEARS. IN YEARS 1-3, THE NU GROUP WILL ALSO FACILITATE THE NLP DEVELOPMENT. IN YEARS 4-5, THE NU GROUP WILL THEN
APPLY THE PVTK JOINTLY DEVELOPED TO VALIDATE KNOWN ADES AND TO DETECT NEW ADES SIGNALS FROM THE EHR
RECORDS WITH A PVTK INSTALLATION BEHIND THE FIREWALL OF THE NORTHWESTERN ENTERPRISE DATA WAREHOUSE. THESE
INVESTIGATORS WILL ALSO PARTICIPATE IN DATA ANALYSIS, PREPARATION OF ABSTRACTS, SCIENTIFIC ARTICLES, & FORMAL
PRESENTATION OF RESULTS.

YEARS. IN YEARS 1-3, THE NU GROUP WILL ALSO FACILITATE THE NLP DEVELOPMENT. IN YEARS 4-5, THE NU GROUP WILL THEN
APPLY THE PVTK JOINTLY DEVELOPED TO VALIDATE KNOWN ADES AND TO DETECT NEW ADES SIGNALS FROM THE EHR
RECORDS WITH A PVTK INSTALLATION BEHIND THE FIREWALL OF THE NORTHWESTERN ENTERPRISE DATA WAREHOUSE. THESE
INVESTIGATORS WILL ALSO PARTICIPATE IN DATA ANALYSIS, PREPARATION OF ABSTRACTS, SCIENTIFIC ARTICLES, & FORMAL
PRESENTATION OF RESULTS.

subaward_description: NINE DOORS INCLUDE HARDWARE, DOOR OPERATORS AND INSTALLATION IS ESTIMATED AT $59,000. THE ACCESS CONTROL SYSTEM FOR 9 ACCESS POINTS INCLUDES ELECTRONICS, COMPONENTS, TRAINING, KEYFOBS AND BLUETOOTH AND IS ESTIMATED TO BE $43,000. THIS IS $35,000 IN HARDWARE AND $8,000 OF SUBSCRIPTION FEES. THE VIDEO SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM WILL BE CLOSED SYSTEM WITH 18 CAMERAS (16 OUTSIDE, 2 INSIDE) AT STRATEGIC LOCATIONS AND IS ESTIMATED TO BE $34,700. THIS SYSTEM INCLUDES CAMERAS, 5 MONITORS, SERVER, BACK-UP POWER SUPPLY, INSTALLATION, AND TRAINING FOR $32,000. THE CHURCH REQUIRES UPGRADED INTERNET INFRASTRUCTURE FOR THE CAPABILITY WHICH IS ESTIMATED AT $2,700 THROUGH THE POP. 12 RECHARGEABLE SECURITY GRADE PORTABLE RADIOS AT AN ESTIMATED COST OF $3,600. THE FIREWALLED FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT COMPUTER AND ACCESSORIES IS ESTIMATED TO COST $1,500 AND WILL BE USED BY THE TREASURER EXCLUSIVELY FOR CHURCH FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT. PLAYGROUND GATE IS ESTIMATED TO BE $1200. ADD TINT AND/OR BLAST/SHOCK PROTECTION FOR APPROXIMATELY 30 FIRST FLOOR WINDOWS IS $5,000. A SUBSCRIPTION TO THE FAITH-BASED INFORMATION SHARING & ANALYSIS ORGANIZATION (FB-ISAO) WILL ASSIST IN SECURITY PLANNING AND THREATS. ENTERPRISE MEMBERSHIP IS $2,000 THROUGH THE POP AND WILL ALLOW COORDINATION AND INFORMATION SHARING WITH THIS FUSION CENTER.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: Developing a PRogram to Educate and Sensitize Caregivers to Reduce the Inappropriate Prescription Burden in Elderly with Alzheimer's Disease Study (D-PRESCRIBE-AD)
subaward_description:
HARVARD PILGRIM HEALTH CARE (HPHC) WILL CONDUCT THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES AS AN ACTIVE PARTICIPANT IN THE D-PRESCRIBE-AD STUDY. HPHC WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SAS PROGRAMMING, QUERY FULFILMENT (DISTRIBUTIONS OF SAS PROGRAMS/"WORKPLANS", AND AGGREGATION OF RESULTS), AND SUPPORT RELATED TO THE SENTINEL COMMON DATA MODEL (SCDM) AND TECHNICAL INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDED FOR THESE ACTIVITIES. 
HPHC WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL EXPERTISE IN PHARMACOEPIDEMIOLOGY AND DATA SCIENCE NEEDED TO SUPPORT THE PROPOSED WORK AND THE RELATED SECURE INFRASTRUCTURE TO CONDUCT QUERYING ACTIVITIES. HPHC WILL MAINTAIN FISMA-COMPLIANT SECURE FILE SHARING AND QUERYING INFRASTRUCTURE, AND COORDINATE QUERYING ACTIVITIES. HPHC WILL COLLABORATE WITH STUDY LEAD AND HEALTH PLAN LEADERSHIP, INVESTIGATORS, AND STAFF FROM THE DATA PARTNERS (DPS) TO DEVELOP AN INTERVENTIONAL STUDY PROTOCOL. 
QUERYING WILL BE CONDUCTED IN A DISTRIBUTED APPROACH, ALLOWING DPS TO MAINTAIN PHYSICAL AND OPERATIONAL CONTROL OF THEIR DATA. THIS APPROACH ALLOWS A COMPLEX ANALYTIC PROGRAM (E.G., A SAS PROGRAM USED TO IDENTIFY COHORTS) TO BE SECURELY DISTRIBUTED TO ALL PARTNERS FOR EXECUTION BEHIND THEIR FIREWALLS WITHOUT MODIFICATION. RESULTS ARE REVIEWED LOCALLY AND SECURELY AND RETURNED TO HPHC FOR ANALYSIS AND REPORTING. THIS STUDY WILL LEVERAGE THE SCDM. ALL DATA PARTNERS ARE PARTICIPANTS OF THE FDA SENTINEL PROJECT AND WILL USE THEIR APPROVED LOCAL IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SENTINEL COM FOR QUERYING.

subawardee_business_types: U.S. STATE GOVERNMENT,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
THE PURPOSE OF THE VASCULAR IMAGING CORE FACILITY (VIC) IS TO ASSURE UNIFORM INTERPRETATION FOR CAROTID ARTERY
DUPLEX ULTRASOUND (DU) EXAMINATION, COMPUTED TOMOGRAPHY (CT) AND MAGNETIC RESONANCE (MR) ANGIOGRAPHY,
AND UNIFORM INTERPRETATION OF BRAIN CT AND MR IMAGING STUDIES ACROSS ALL CLINICAL CENTERS PARTICIPATING IN THE
CREST2 TRIAL. A SECOND PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE A SAFE AND SECURE REPOSITORY OF THE LARGE AMOUNT OF IMAGING FILES
THAT ARE ANTICIPATED TO BE GENERATED THROUGH THE COURSE OF THE TRIAL. MANAGING A HIGH-QUALITY AND EFFICIENT CORE
FACILITY REQUIRES AN INVESTMENT IN RESOURCES AND TIME BY QUALIFIED INDIVIDUALS.
WE HAVE LEVERAGED INNOVATIVE APPROACHES TO STRIKE A BALANCE BETWEEN THE NEED TO MAINTAIN HIGH-QUALITY DATA
WHILE KEEPING THE ASSOCIATED COSTS AS LOW AS POSSIBLE. THE VASCULAR IMAGING CORE WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE WRITING
OF THE CREST2 H GRANT PROPOSAL. THE VIC AT U MARYLAND WILL MAINTAIN ELECTRONIC LINKAGES WITH EACH CLINICAL
CENTER APPROVED TO RANDOMIZE PATIENTS IN THE TRIAL. INDIVIDUAL CENTERS WILL UTILIZE THIS FILE TRANSFER PROTOCOL (FTP) TO
TRANSFER IMAGES ACQUIRED FOR CREST-2 H. THE IMAGES WILL BE STORED IN A HIPAA-COMPLIANT, FIREWALL PROTECTED
SERVER WITHIN THE U MARYLAND ARCHIVAL SYSTEM. THE SYSTEM UNDERGOES DAILY INTEGRITY CHECKS, DAILY BACKUPS
LOCALLY, WEEKLY BACKUPS REMOTELY, AND MONTHLY TAPE BACKUPS REMOTELY. A CREST-2 DEDICATED FTP LINKAGE WILL
BE MAINTAINED BETWEEN THE VIC AT U MARYLAND AND UCLA; AND THE VIC AT U MARYLAND AND U ROCHESTER. THESE
LINKAGES WILL BE UTILIZED TO MAKE EACH IMAGE FILE AVAILABLE FOR VIEWING AND/OR DOWNLOAD (AS NECESSARY) BY UCLA
(LIEBESKIND LAB) FOR PROCESSING OF THE PERFUSION STUDIES. A COPY OF THE IMAGE FILES WILL ALSO BE MADE AVAILABLE TO
U ROCHESTER (HUSTON LAB) FOR QA AND FOR QUANTIFICATION OF WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITY VOLUMES (WMHV),
PRESENCE OF SILENT INFARCTS, AND MICROBLEEDS.

subaward_description:
THE PURPOSE OF THE VASCULAR IMAGING CORE FACILITY (VIC) IS TO ASSURE UNIFORM INTERPRETATION FOR CAROTID ARTERY DUPLEX ULTRASOUND (DU) EXAMINATION, COMPUTED TOMOGRAPHY (CT) AND MAGNETIC RESONANCE (MR) ANGIOGRAPHY, AND UNIFORM INTERPRETATION OF BRAIN CT AND MR IMAGING STUDIES ACROSS ALL CLINICAL CENTERS PARTICIPATING IN THE CREST2 TRIAL. A SECOND PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE A SAFE AND SECURE REPOSITORY OF THE LARGE AMOUNT OF IMAGING FILES THAT ARE ANTICIPATED TO BE GENERATED THROUGH THE COURSE OF THE TRIAL. MANAGING A HIGH-QUALITY AND EFFICIENT CORE FACILITY REQUIRES AN INVESTMENT IN RESOURCES AND TIME BY QUALIFIED INDIVIDUALS. 

WE HAVE LEVERAGED INNOVATIVE APPROACHES TO STRIKE A BALANCE BETWEEN THE NEED TO MAINTAIN HIGH-QUALITY DATA WHILE KEEPING THE ASSOCIATED COSTS AS LOW AS POSSIBLE. THE VASCULAR IMAGING CORE WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE WRITING OF THE CREST2 H GRANT PROPOSAL. THE VIC AT U MARYLAND WILL MAINTAIN ELECTRONIC LINKAGES WITH EACH CLINICAL CENTER APPROVED TO RANDOMIZE PATIENTS IN THE TRIAL. INDIVIDUAL CENTERS WILL UTILIZE THIS FILE TRANSFER PROTOCOL (FTP) TO TRANSFER IMAGES ACQUIRED FOR CREST-2 H. THE IMAGES WILL BE STORED IN A HIPAA-COMPLIANT, FIREWALL PROTECTED SERVER WITHIN THE U MARYLAND ARCHIVAL SYSTEM. THE SYSTEM UNDERGOES DAILY INTEGRITY CHECKS, DAILY BACKUPS LOCALLY, WEEKLY BACKUPS REMOTELY, AND MONTHLY TAPE BACKUPS REMOTELY. A CREST-2 DEDICATED FTP LINKAGE WILL BE MAINTAINED BETWEEN THE VIC AT U MARYLAND AND UCLA; AND THE VIC AT U MARYLAND AND U ROCHESTER. THESE LINKAGES WILL BE UTILIZED TO MAKE EACH IMAGE FILE AVAILABLE FOR VIEWING AND/OR DOWNLOAD (AS NECESSARY) BY UCLA (LIEBESKIND LAB) FOR PROCESSING OF THE PERFUSION STUDIES. A COPY OF THE IMAGE FILES WILL ALSO BE MADE AVAILABLE TO U ROCHESTER (HUSTON LAB) FOR QA AND FOR QUANTIFICATION OF WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITY VOLUMES (WMHV), PRESENCE OF SILENT INFARCTS, AND MICROBLEEDS.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: Using a Restorative Justice Approach to Enrich School Climate and Improve School Safety
prime_award_cfda_numbers_and_titles: 16.560: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF JUSTICE RESEARCH, EVALUATION, AND DEVELOPMENT PROJECT GRANTS
subaward_description: PROV PLAN WILL BE ACTING AS THE DATA INTERMEDIARY FOR THE PROJECT'S THIRD PARTY EVALUATOR, THE URBAN INSTITUTE.  UI WILL BE CONDUCTING A PROCESS EVALUATION AND AN OUTCOME EVALUATION. UI WILL COLLECT, STORE, AND ANALYZE DE-IDENTIFIED PROCESS EVALUATION DATA UNDER THE GUIDANCE OF ITS INTERNAL IRB.  PROV PLAN WILL PROVIDE DE-IDENTIFIED, LINKED ADMINISTRATIVE DATA THROUGH ITS INTERGRATED DATA SYSTEM, THE "RI DATA HUB."  INTEGRATED DATA CURRENTLY HOUSED IN THE RI DATAHUB INLCUDES INFORMATION FROM VARIOUS RHODE ISLAND STATE DEPARTMENTS INCLUDING EDUCATION; HEALTH: CHILDREN, YOUTH AND FAMILIES; LABOR AND TRAINING; AND STUDENT DATA FROM INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION IN RHODE ISLAND.  ONCE INDIVIDUALLY IDENTIFIABLE DATA SETS ARE MERGED WITHIN THE SECURE DATAHUB, SIMILAR DATA FROM CROSS-AGENCY SOURCES CAN BE ANALYZED.  PROV PLAN WILL ENSURE THAT A SUFFICIENT FIREWALL IS IN PLACE TO LIMIT ACCESS TO AND VIEWING OF INDIVIDUALLY IDENTIFIABLE, LINKED DATA BY PROVPLAN STAFF, AND WILL ENSURE THAT INFROMATION PROVIDED TO THIRD PARTIES, EXCEPTING UI, IS AT THE AGGREGATE LEVEL.

subawardee_dba_name: JOAN & SANFORD I WEILL MEDICAL COLLEGE OF CORNELL UNIVERSITY
subawardee_business_types: SELF-CERTIFIED SMALL DISADVANTAGED BUSINESS,FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION,WOMAN-OWNED BUSINESS,LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY
subaward_description:
IN ORDER TO PROVIDE THE HIGHEST CYBERSECURITY COMPLIANT ENVIRONMENT WITH DATA-LAKES, STANDARDIZATION
FEATURES, AUTOMATIC DATA INGESTION, QC PROTOCOLS, SYSTEM AUDITING, MONITORING AND ANALYTIC
INTEGRATION CAPACITY - HIVE IS ELECTED AS A BASE PLATFORM FOR MODERNIZATION OF MDEPINET CRN
BACKBONE.
THERE ARE MULTIPLE SUBSYSTEMS OF THE CRN ECOSYSTEM THAT WILL BE ESTABLISHED AND SUPPORTED:
ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ HARDWARE SUB-SYSTEM
ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ DATA COLLECTION SUB-SUBSYSTEM
ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ DATA TYPING/STANDARDIZATION SUB-SYSTEM
ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ DATA STORAGE SUB-SYSTEM
ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ SECURITY SUB-SYSTEM
ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ PROVENANCE SUB-SYSTEM
ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ PROCESS SUB-SYSTEM
ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ WEB-APP VISUALIZATION SUB-SYSTEM
ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ ANALYTICS SUB-SYSTEM
1. HARDWARE SUB-SYSTEM
1.1. INSTANTIATION OF HIGH CORE DENSITY, HIGH STORAGE CAPACITY UNITS THAT ARE FIT TO SUPPORT HIVE
SERVICES.
1.2. NETWORK CONFIGURATION, STATIC IP AND DOMAIN NAME ASSOCIATION, FIREWALL TUNING AND IP SERVICES
CONFIGURATION.
1.3. SETUP OF EXTERNAL PIPELINES FOR EXPORTING AUDIT LOGS, BACKUPS, AND CONFIGURATION RECOVERY
INFORMATION.
1.4. ESTABLISHMENT OF USER GROUPS, ROLES, PERMISSIONS, AND ACCESS CONTROL PROTOCOLS DEFINED BY THE
CLIENT.
2. DATA COLLECTION SUB-SYSTEM
2.1. BATCH DATA INGESTION PIPELINES
2.2. DATA UPLOAD PORTAL
2.3. FRONT-END API FOR WEB-APP DATA ENTRY FORMS
2.4. BACKEND DATA INGESTION ENGINE
3. DATA TYPING/STANDARDIZATION SUB-SYSTEM
OPERATING AS MDEPINET-HIVE
THE INFORMATION CONTAINED IN THIS DOCUMENT IS STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL AND IS INTENDED FOR THE ADDRESSEE ONLY. THE UNAUTHORIZED USE, DISCLOSURE,
COPYING, ALTERATION, OR DISTRIBUTION OF THIS DOCUMENT IS STRICTLY PROHIBITED AND MAY BE UNLAWFUL
3.1. SOFTWARE FACILITIES FOR CREATION OF SUBJECT SPECIFIC CORE ELEMENTS
3.2. LOGICAL CONSTRAINTS IMPLEMENTATION LAYER
3.3. VALIDATION RULES IMPLEMENTATION FOR ACCEPTANCE OF FORMS
3.4. ONTOLOGICAL DEFINITION LINKAGE ENGINE
4. DATA STORAGE SUBSYSTEM
4.1. ASSIGNATION OF ARCHIVAL UNIQUE IDENTIFIERS FOR REFERABLE URL LINKED RECORDS TO REGISTRY ELEMENTS.
4.2. WEB-API BASED DATA ID BASED DOWNLOAD BASED ON SEARCH QUERIES BY VALUES OF FIELDS, DATA
TYPES, OWNERSHIP OR ASSIGNED SHARING ROLES.
4.3. FILE BASED ACCESS THROUGH VIRTUAL FOLDER INFRASTRUCTURE WITH TABULARIZED CSV, XLSX, XPT FILES IN
ORDER TO PROVIDE USERS ACCESS TO INTEGRATED DATASETS FROM STATISTICAL SOFTWARE PACKAGES SUCH
AS R OR SAS AND OTHER STANDALONE UTILITIES.
4.4. REGULAR BACKUPS OF DATASETS TO EXTERNAL STORAGE CAPACITY AS ESTABLISHED BY CLIENTS PRIORITIES
5. SECURITY SUB-SYSTEM
5.1. HIVE DATASTORE WILL PROVIDE TO MDEPINET DRIVEN REGISTRIES ALL FUNDAMENTAL FUNCTIONS OF SECURE
KEEPING OF RECORDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH NIST-800 SERIES SYSTEM CONTROL REQUIREMENTS AND FDA
ATO-ED SYSTEM COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS.
5.2. DATA STRIPING ECOSYSTEM FOR SECURE DISTRIBUTION OF DATA ELEMENTS
6. PROVENANCE SUB-SYSTEM
6.1. AUDIT LOGGING OF EVERY SINGLE SECURE TRANSACTION ON DATA WRITE/READ/EDIT/LIST/DELETE. ALL AUDIT
LOGS WILL BE EXPORTED TO EXTERNAL STORAGE FOR POTENTIAL FUTURE INCIDENT RESOLUTION.
6.2. MONITORING LOGS FOR OVERALL SYSTEM PERFORMANCE AND BENCHMARKING AS WELL AS FOR SYSTEM
AVAILABILITY AND INCIDENT NOTIFICATION.
6.3. DATA OWNERSHIP POLICY ENFORCING ENGINE THROUGH BLOCKCHAIN
6.4. SMART-CONTRACT LAYER FOR ACTIVE POLICY ENFORCEMENT (BLOCKCHAIN OR ALTERNATIVE)
7. PROCESSUAL SUB-SYSTEM
7.1. INTERDEPENDENT SURVEY MAPS
7.2. TIME DEPENDENT SURVEY ACTIVATION
7.3. SURVEY NOTIFICATION AND TIMED TRIGGER FUNCTIONALITY
8. WEB-APP VISUALIZATION SUB-SYSTEM
IN ORDER TO PROVIDE FACILITIES FOR MANUAL DATA ENTRY AS WELL AS PROVIDE MEANS FOR ACCESSING DATA OR
ANALYTICAL FACILITIES BY ADMINISTRATORS AND RESEARCH SCIENTISTS - A WEB-BASED FRONT END SOFTWARE WILL BE
DEVELOPED ACCESSIBLE THROUGH HTML PROTOCOLS ON NOTEBOOKS AND PCS (WINDOWS, LUNIX, MAC) AND
MOBILE DEVICES (IOS, ANDROID, OTHERS). THE FOLLOWING MAJOR STEPS ARE NECESSARY
8.1. MOBILE WEB-APPLICATION
OPERATING AS MDEPINET-HIVE
THE INFORMATION CONTAINED IN THIS DOCUMENT IS STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL AND IS INTENDED FOR THE ADDRESSEE ONLY. THE UNAUTHORIZED USE, DISCLOSURE,
COPYING, ALTERATION, OR DISTRIBUTION OF THIS DOCUMENT IS STRICTLY PROHIBITED AND MAY BE UNLAWFUL
8.2. VISUAL DASHBOARDS FOR EXAMINING SUMMATIVE INFORMATION
8.3. DESIGN WEB-FORM ENGINE THAT RENDERS THE EDITABLE HTML FORM ON A WEB PAGE
8.4. ENSURE CONFORMANCE WITH RESPONSIVE DESIGN (SIZE, SCREEN, ORIENTATION AND FONT DYNAMIC
REARRANGEMENTS)
8.5. ENSURE COMPATIBILITY WITH PC, MAC AND MOBILE DEVICES SUCH AS TABLETS, PHONES
8.6. PATIENT AND CLINICIAN DATA ENTRY WEB-PAGES
8.7. RESEARCHER DATA QUERY PAGES FOR SEARCHING INFORMATION ON COLLECTED DATA
8.8. RESEARCHER DOWNLOAD PAGES TO ACCESS/DOWNLOAD COLLECTED DATA
8.9. RESEARCHER ANALYTICAL WEB-PAGES, DASHBOARD FOR COLLECTED DATA ANALYSIS USING EMBEDDED
ALGORITHMS
8.10. ADMINISTRATOR DASHBOARD FOR QUERYING THE STATE OF THE REGISTRY AND CONTROLLING ACCESS RIGHTS
AND PERMISSIONS
8.11. SURVEY DESIGNER
9. ANALYTICS SUB-SYSTEM
9.1. MODULAR ANALYTICS ATTACHMENT ENGINE
9.2. STATISTICAL ANALYSIS R PACKAGE LINKAGE
9.3. IMPLEMENTATION OF USE-CASE SPECIFIC ANALYTICS TOOLKITS
9.4. LINKAGE OF ANALYTICAL OUTCOMES TO VISUALIZATIONS ON THE WEB-APP

prime_award_cfda_numbers_and_titles: 93.865: CHILD HEALTH AND HUMAN DEVELOPMENT EXTRAMURAL RESEARCH
subawardee_business_types: U.S. LOCAL GOVERNMENT,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
ASYNCHRONOUS TRAINING:
THE IMTR GROUP WILL ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING:
1. DEVELOP AN INTERACTIVE, MULTIMEDIA TUTORIAL FOCUSED ON GOOD PRESCRIBING PRACTICES AND GOOD COMMUNICATION PRACTICES, AND IS ACCESSIBLE FROM THE INTERNET VIA A SECURE WEBSITE.  THIS RESOURCE WILL BE VIEWED INDIVIDUALLY BY PARTICIPATING PROVIDERS AT A TIME THAT IS CONVENIENT FOR THEM, OVER APPROXIMATELY 40 MINUTES OF VIEWING TIME.  POST-TEST SCORES AND END-USER ACTIVITY WILL BE RECORDED AND REPORTED. THIS CONTENT WILL PROVIDE THE FOUNDATIONAL MATERIAL FOR THE PLANNED SYNCHRONOUS WEBINAR SERIES. 
2. PRODUCE THREE Ã¢Â‚¬Å“BOOSTERÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½ 10-MINUTE VIGNETTES SHOWING AN INTERACTION BETWEEN TWO ACTORS (A DOCTOR AND A PARENT/PATIENT) WHERE EITHER GOOD OR BAD COMMUNICATION PRACTICES OCCUR. VIEWERS WILL THEN BE ASKED QUESTIONS ABOUT THE VIEWED COMMUNICATION, AND PROVIDED FEEDBACK ON THEIR ANSWERS. POST-TEST SCORES AND END-USER ACTIVITY WILL BE RECORDED AND REPORTED.
3. MANAGE THE ONLINE RESOURCES ONCE IN THE FIELD. (SOLVING FIREWALL ISSUES, RECORDING USE, ETC.)
4. ONCE RESOURCES ARE DEVELOPED AND PILOTED AMONG PROS PRACTICES, AN APPLICATION FOR MAINTENANCE OF CERTIFICATION CREDIT FOR PRACTICE MEASUREMENT (MOC-4) WILL BE DEVELOPED. 
5. DR. STOUT, THE IMTR LEAD, AND MR. BURGES, THE IMTR SOFTWARE ENGINEER, WILL TRAVEL AS NEEDED IN SUPPORT OF THE DART PROJECT. 
THE 40-MINUTE INTERACTIVE TRAINING TOOL WILL BE PRODUCED OVER AN 18-MONTH SCHEDULE. THE 10-MINUTE VIGNETTES WILL BE DEVELOPED SUBSEQUENTLY. 

SYNCHRONOUS TRAINING:
THE IMTR GROUP WILL ALSO LEAD A SERIES OF TWO 60-MINUTE WEBINARS ACROSS FIVE SEQUENTIAL WAVES OF PRACTICES OVER A 12-MONTH PERIOD. ONE SESSION WILL FOCUS ON PRESCRIBING PRACTICES AND THE OTHER WILL FOCUS ON COMMUNICATION PRACTICES. 
AT THESE SESSIONS EXPERT FACULTY WILL REVIEW KEY POINTS MADE IN THE DIDACTIC TUTORIAL, PRESENT VIDEO VIGNETTES OF KEY COMMUNICATION BEHAVIORS, AND THEN LEAD INTERACTIVE DISCUSSION WITH PARTICIPANTS. THERE WILL BE 10 TO 15 PRACTICES IN EACH PARTICIPATING PRACTICE GROUP.

prime_award_cfda_numbers_and_titles: 93.345: LEADING EDGE ACCELERATION PROJECTS (LEAP) IN HEALTH INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY
subaward_description:
"PREPARATORY WORK PRIOR TO GRANT PERIOD BEGINNING OCTOBER 2021:
1. SET UP A SECURE AWS ENVIRONMENT
2. SEEK LOCAL APPROVALS TO INSTALL THE CUMULUS PIPELINE BEHIND RUSHÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã¢Â€ŽÂ¢S FIREWALL
- A. APPROVAL TO LOAD PATIENT-DERIVED DATA INTO AWS FOR RESEARCH ACTIVITY
B. APPROVAL TO RUN CUMULUS CONTAINER CODE LOCALLY
3. SEEK IRB APPROVAL TO PERFORM CHART REVIEWS FOR SYNDROMIC SURVEILLANCE AND SHARE A LABELED DATASET WITH BCH
WORK TARGETING MARCH 2022 COMPLETION:
1. IMPLEMENT THE CUMULUS PIPELINE:
A. MAP DATA TO BULK FHIR TO SIMULATE BULK FHIR EXTRACTION FOR INPUT INTO CUMULUS PIPELINE.
B. EXPORT CLINICAL NOTES, CHIEF COMPLAINTS, AND ED REASON FOR VISIT FOR INPUT INTO THE CUMULUS PIPELINE.
C. INSTALL A CUMULUS NODE IN A SECURE AWS ENVIRONMENT AND CONNECT IT TO RUSH BULK FHIR DATA AND CLINICAL NOTES.
WORK TARGETING SEPTEMBER 2022 COMPLETION:
1. MAINTAIN AN UPDATED INSTALLATION OF THE CUMULUS PIPELINE.
2. EXTRACT COVID, FLU, AND RSV SURVEILLANCE DATA AND CONCATENATE RESULTS WITH BULK FHIR IN CUMULUS
A. PERFORM CHART REVIEWS FOR RESPIRATORY INFECTION SURVEILLANCE AND CREATE A LABELED TRAINING SET FROM THE CUMULUS NODE EXTRACT.
B. WORK WITH BCH ON ANALYSIS AND CLASSIFIER TRAINING."

prime_award_base_transaction_description: Flexible NLP toolkit for automatic curation of outcomes for breast cancer patients - Project summary/Abstract Breast cancer has the largest number of new cases in world (11.7%). Although the prognosis of breast cancer patients is generally favorable due to early detection and comprehensive treatment, 20%–30% of patients will still develop distant metastases and cases with progressive stage only have a median two-year survival time. Breast cancer is widely recognized as a heterogeneous disease in the sense of both primary tumor metastatic capacity and time to metastatic spread of disease. High-quality population-based cancer surveillance data are needed to: (1) describe cancer burden, patterns, and outcomes in order to (2) inform cancer prevention, detection and control activities; and (3) evaluate interventions on the basis of past and future trends so that optimal approaches to alleviate burden and suffering from cancer can be adopted. However, the laborious manual curation process makes the population wise surveillance data collection challenging. It has been shown in studies that a large percentage of total registry cost is devoted to labor for data curation, even in the low-income countries. In this project, our mission is to build a flexible NLP toolset that can be executed locally at the institution level and will curate the clinical and patient-centered outcomes of breast cancer patients by parsing longitudinally acquired clinic notes, radiology and pathology reports. In order to test the generalizability of the tools and to initiate their deployment for data collection, we will partner with both Georgia SEER and California state cancer registry and will curate the outcome data of past 10-years breast cancer patients from two institutions across US representing diverse patient populations - Emory University hospital (Georgia) and Stanford Medical Center (California). We will leverage the previously developed tools and technologies and extend them to automatically curate the clinical and patient- centered outcome data – recurrence date and site of recurrence, treatment administered, mental and physical outcomes – from clinic notes and convert these into structured and query-able format. The NLP tools will be dockerized and run locally at the hospital registry level for automated outcome curation. Finally, the NLP extracted outcomes will be shared with State Cancer registry for evaluation. From a methodological perspective, the framework and the open-source software tools developed can be employed for cancer research beyond the scope of our project for curating outcomes regardless of the problem domain.
subawardee_business_types: PRIVATE UNIVERSITY OR COLLEGE,NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description:
THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AN OPEN-SOURCE GENERALIZABLE NLP TOOLKIT FOR CURATION OF PATIENTCENTERED AND CLINICAL OUTCOMES AUTOMATICALLY BY PARSING THE FREE-TEXT CLINIC NOTES. THE TOOLS WILL BE RUN 
LOCALLY WITHIN THE HOSPITAL FIREWALL AND WILL REQUIRE MINIMAL COMPUTATIONAL RESOURCE FOR EXECUTION AT THE 
LOCAL CENTERS FOR COMPREHENSIVE BREAST CANCER DATA CURATION, INCLUDING PHYSICAL AND MENTAL TREATMENT 
SIDE-EFFECTS. THIS WILL BE IMMENSELY VALUABLE TO ENABLE LARGE-SCALE STUDIES ON CANCER OUTCOMES AS WELL AS 
HELP DEVELOP ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE ALGORITHMS FOR OUTCOME PREDICTION. 
THE GEORGIA CANCER REGISTRY WILL: 
1. ASSIST WITH ADMINISTRATIVE APPROVALS NEEDED TO UNDERTAKE THE STUDY IN GEORGIA 
2. PARTICIPATE IN REGULAR CONFERENCE CALLS WITH THE PI AND RESEARCH TEAMS. 
3. ASSIST WITH FINALIZATION OF STUDY PROTOCOLS AND PROVIDE REGULAR UPDATES OF STUDY PROGRESS IN 
GEORGIA 
4. HELP TO EVALUATE THE OPEN-SOURCE NLP TOOLKIT FOR CANCER DATA CURATION FROM FREE-TEXT CLINIC NOTES 
5. USE REGISTRY CTR STAFF TO MANUALLY CURATE (ANNOTATE) A DATASET OF 400 ANNOTATED TEXT SNIPPETS 
EXTRACTED FROM EMORY PATIENTÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã¢Â€ŽÂ¢S CLINICAL NOTES WITH 50 INDIVIDUAL INSTANCES FOR EACH PATIENT 
OUTCOME OF INTEREST 
6. USE REGISTRY CTR STAFF TO MANUALLY CURATE 1000 RANDOMLY SELECTED PATIENTS WITH A FIRST PRIMARY 
BREAST CANCER WHICH WILL BE CURATED FOR ALL THE TREATMENTS ADMINISTERED AND 5 YEARS RECURRENCE 
7. LINK THE FINAL EMORY BREAST COHORT, 2010-2019, WITH THE GEORGIA CANCER REGISTRY 
8. ADVISE ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF BI-DIRECTIONAL COMMUNICATION WORKFLOW BETWEEN THE STATE CANCER 
REGISTRY AND LOCAL INSTITUTIONS 
9. HELP TO SCALE THE TECHNOLOGIES DEVELOPED IN THIS GRANT TO OTHER CANCER REGISTRIES THROUGH SHARING 
THE NLP TOOLKITS AND MODELS WITH OTHER FACILITIES TO EXECUTE ON THE TARGETED CLINIC NOTES LOCALLY IN 
A DOCKER CONTAINER 
10. PARTICIPATE IN DATA ANALYSIS, INTERPRETATION OF RESULTS AND MANUSCRIPTS AS DESIRED BY THE 
CONTRACTING PI

subaward_description: CHRISTIAN COUNTY FISCAL COURT SHALL UTILIZE STATE LOCAL CYBERSECURITY GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS TO PURCHASE IT AND NETWORKING INFRASTRUCTURE TO STRENGTHEN CYBERSECURITY RESILIENCE. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY COMPUTER/FIREWALL UPGRADES TO ENHANCE PROTECTION FROM THREATS, IMPLEMENTING POLICY GOVERNING REMOTE ACCESS, AND INCREASING CAPABILITY TO PROTECT AGAINST PHYSICAL INTRUSION.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: State of Wisconsin FY 19 JAG Application
prime_award_cfda_numbers_and_titles: 16.738: EDWARD BYRNE MEMORIAL JUSTICE ASSISTANCE GRANT PROGRAM
subaward_description: WILL USE FUNDS TO UPGRADE OUR SERVER AND ONE COMPUTER THROUGH OUR PARTNERSHIP WITH OUR COMPUTER CONSULTANTS INTERQUEST. THE UPDATED EQUIPMENT WILL INVOLVE OUR ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT'S COMPUTER UPGRADE, SCANNER, SERVER, OPERATING SYSTEM, AND HOST MACHINE WITH A WINDOWS SERVER UPGRADE, OUR FIREWALL AND WIRELESS PROTECTION, OUR VIDEO SYSTEM, AN MDC TO RUN THE SERVER, AND OTHER OLD RECORDS MANAGEMENT SYSTEM CROSS OVER. AS OF MAY 25, 2022, PRESIDENT BIDEN ISSUED THE EXECUTIVE ORDER ON ADVANCING EFFECTIVE ACCOUNTABLE POLICING AND CRIMINAL JUSTICE PRACTICES TO ENHANCE PUBLIC TRUST AND PUBLIC SAFETY (E.O. 14074). DOJ REVIEW OF THE TRANSITION OF LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES TO THE NIBRS SHOWS 76% OF AGENCIES THAT ARE REPORTING TO WIIBRS. AS OF JANUARY 2018, OUR DEPARTMENT TRANSITIONED TO AN RMS AND REPORTS TO WIBRS. WITH THIS TRANSITION AND HOW FAST TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPS IS THE OVERSIGHT OF THE EQUIPMENT THAT SENDS OR SUPPORTS THIS RMS.

prime_award_awarding_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
prime_award_funding_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
prime_awardee_business_types: Nonprofit with 501C3 IRS Status (Other than an Institution of Higher Education)
prime_award_base_transaction_description: THE NEIGHBORHOOD: POAG HERITABLE OVERALL OPERATIONAL DATABASE
subawardee_name: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN
subawardee_parent_name: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN
subawardee_business_types: U.S. STATE GOVERNMENT,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
OUR CENTER WILL RECRUIT 200 OPEN-ANGLE GLAUCOMA CASES AND 200 CONTROLS, RECRUITING AND CARRYING OUT
CLINICAL EXAMS ON FIFTY CASES AND 50 CONTROLS PER YEAR WITH AN EMPHASIS ON RECRUITING NORMAL TENSION
GLAUCOMA CASES. ALL SUBJECTS WILL PARTICIPATE IN INFORMED CONSENT ACCORDING TO A PROTOCOL APPROVED BY
THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN INSTITUTIONAL REVIEW BOARD. THE OPHTHALMOLOGIC EXAMINATIONS WILL BE
CARRIED OUT BY GLAUCOMA SPECIALISTS SAYOKO MOROI, MD, PHD, AND JOSHUA STEIN, MD, MS. THE EXAMS
WILL INCLUDE DILATED EYE EXAMS, OCT, VISUAL FIELDS, BIOMETRY AND FUNDUS PHOTOGRAPHY, AND THE PATIENTS
WILL BE FOLLOWED HERE OVER TIME SO THAT WE CAN PROVIDE LONGITUDINAL INFORMATION REGARDING PROGRESSION.
PATIENTS SELECTED FOR INCLUSION IN THE STUDY WILL BE SELECTED BASED ON THE NEIGHBORHOOD INCLUSION
AND EXCLUSION CRITERIA. WE WILL OBTAIN BLOOD SAMPLES, ARCHIVE DNA AT -80OC, PREPARE DNA, AND DO
QUALITY CONTROL AND QUANTIFICATION ON THE DNA. CLINICAL DATA AND DNA WILL BE TRANSFERRED TO THE
NEIGHBORHOOD STUDY WITH APPROPRIATE ANONYMIZATION OF DATA FOR PROTECTION OF STUDY SUBJECTS. WE
WILL ALSO WORK TO EXTRACT FOLLOW UP DATA ON CONTINUING VISITS BY PATIENTS WHOSE DNA WAS PREVIOUSLY
CONTRIBUTED TO THE NEIGHBORHOOD STUDY. ALL INFORMATION IN OUR GLAUCOMA GENETICS STUDIES IS
RETAINED IN A DATABASE SETUP CONTAINED ON SERVERS BEHIND UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN FIREWALLS, WITH THE
SAME LEVEL OF PROTECTIONS AND SECURITY AFFORDED TO CLINICAL DATA AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN HEALTH
SYSTEMS. COMBINING THESE SAMPLES TOGETHER WITH SAMPLES FROM OTHER NEIGHBORHOOD CENTERS WILL
HELP TO SUBSTANTIALLY EXPAND THE NEIGHBORHOOD DNA RESOURCES, LEADING TO INCREASED POWER TO
DETECT NEW GLAUCOMA GENETIC RISK FACTORS AND TO CARRY OUT GENOTYPE PHENOTYPE CORRELATION STUDIES.

COMBINING THESE SAMPLES TOGETHER WITH SAMPLES FROM OTHER NEIGHBORHOOD CENTERS WILL HELP TO SUBSTANTIALLY EXPAND THE NEIGHBORHOOD DNA RESOURCES, LEADING TO INCREASED POWER TO DETECT NEW GLAUCOMA GENETIC RISK FACTORS AND TO CARRY OUT GENOTYPE PHENOTYPE CORRELATION STUDIES.

prime_award_program_activities_funding_t: 0022: NATIONAL CRIMINAL RECORDS HISTORY IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (NCHIP)
prime_awardee_name: TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION
prime_award_base_transaction_description: 2016 State of Tennessee National Criminal Improvement Program
subaward_description:
THE GOAL OF THE NATIONAL CRIMINAL HISTORY IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (NCHIP) IS TO IMPROVE THE NATION'S SAFETY AND SECURITY BY ENHANCING THE QUALITY, COMPLETENESS, AND ACCESSIBILITY OF CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORD INFORMATION AND BY INSURING THE NATIONWIDE IMPLEMENTATION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE AND NONCRIMINAL JUSTICE BACKGROUND CHECK SYSTEMS. BJS PROVIDES DIRECT FINANCIAL AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE STATES TO IMPROVE CRIMINAL HISTORY AND OTHER RELATED RECORDS AND TO BUILD THEIR INFRASTRUCTURE TO CONNECT TO NATIONAL RECORD CHECK SYSTEMS BOTH TO SUPPLY INFORMATION AND TO CONDUCT THE REQUISITE CHECKS.

UNDER THIS AWARD, THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION, OFFICE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE PROGRAMS WILL TRANSFER FUNDS TO TENNESSEE BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION PROPOSES TO USE FUNDING FROM THIS AWARD, OVER AN 18-MONTH PERIOD, FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORD IMPROVEMENT (CHRI) PROJECT. THE CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORD IMPROVEMENT PROJECT IS A STRATEGIC, MULTI-PHASED APPROACH DESIGNED TO SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE THE QUALITY, COMPLETENESS, AND INTERSTATE ACCESSIBILITY OF CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORD INFORMATION THAT THE TBI IS CHARGED WITH MAINTAINING.  PHASE 1 OF THE CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORD IMPROVEMENT PROJECT IS FUNDED THROUGH THE FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR 2014 AWARD AND IS CURRENTLY IN PROGRESS.  THE TBI PROPOSES TO IMPLEMENT PHASE 2 AS PART OF FUNDING FROM THE FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR 2015 AWARD.  

PHASE 2 OF THE CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORD IMPROVEMENT PROJECT CONSISTS OF TWO PROJECT ACTIVITIES.  THIS FIRST PROJECT ACTIVITY INCLUDES THE PURCHASE ADDITIONAL LIVE SCAN MACHINES FOR THE COUNTY BOOKING AGENCIES THAT INCLUDES A 12-MONTH MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT CONTRACT AND AN UPDATED FIREWALL FOR EACH.   THE SECOND PROJECT ACTIVITY ENCOMPASSES THE REWRITE OF THE ANTIQUATED, COMPUTERIZED CRIMINAL HISTORY DEVELOPMENT CODE.

subawardee_name: BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF RICHLAND COUNTY MONTANA
subaward_description:
UPON COMPLETION THE FACILITY WILL BE HARDENED FROM POTENTIAL ATTACKS IN THE FOLLOWING WAYS. IMPACT RESISTANT EXTERIOR DOORS AND WINDOW SCREENS WILL BE INSTALLED IN THE BUILDINGS.
A NETWORK WITH A STRONG FIREWALL SYSTEM, ANTI-VIRUS PROTECTION, MALWARE PROTECTION WILL BE INSTALLED AND ALL CLUB ELECTRONIC DEVICES CONNECTED TO THE NETWORK.
A PERIMETER FENCE TO MINIMIZE ACCESS TO THE AREA WILL BE INSTALLED.
A SYSTEM WILL BE INSTALLED FOR MEMBER TRACKING, FINANCIAL RECORDS, AND DONOR MANAGEMENT WILL BE INSTALLED AND UTILIZED BY STAFF AND PARENTS.
A LARGE GENERATOR WILL BE INSTALLED TO PROVIDE BACK-UP POWER. TWO-WAY RADIOS WILL BE PURCHASED AND UTILIZED BY STAFF MEMBERS. EXPLOSIVE PROOF TRASH RECEPTACLES WILL BE PURCHASED.
ALL STAFF MEMBERS WILL RECEIVE ONGOING SECURITY TRAINING. STAFF WILL RECEIVE A MINIMUM OF ONE EMERGENCY RESPONSE OR SAFETY TRAINING EACH QUARTER. CHURCH OFFICIALS AND MEMBERS WILL BE INVITED TO PARTICIPATE IN TRAINING PROGRAMS WHEN APPROPRIATE FOR THEIR NEEDS.
TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE RICHLAND COUNTY SAFETY DIRECTOR, BOYS & GIRLS CLUBS OF AMERICA, THE DIRECTOR OF DISASTER EMERGENCY SERVICES, THE LOCAL POLICE DEPARTMENT, MONTANA FUND, AND SENIOR STAFF.

prime_awardee_name: TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTR
prime_award_base_transaction_description: FY 2014 Tennessee National Criminal History Improvement Program
subaward_description: THE GOAL OF THE NATIONAL CRIMINAL HISTORY IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (NCHIP) IS TO IMPROVE THE NATION'S SAFETY AND SECURITY BY ENHANCING THE QUALITY, COMPLETENESS, AND ACCESSIBILITY OF CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORD INFORMATION AND BY INSURING THE NATIONWIDE IMPLEMENTATION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE AND NONCRIMINAL JUSTICE BACKGROUND CHECK SYSTEMS. BJS PROVIDES DIRECT FINANCIAL AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE STATES TO IMPROVE CRIMINAL HISTORY AND OTHER RELATED RECORDS AND TO BUILD THEIR INFRASTRUCTURE TO CONNECT TO NATIONAL RECORD CHECK SYSTEMS BOTH TO SUPPLY INFORMATION AND TO CONDUCT THE REQUISITE CHECKS. UNDER THIS AWARD, THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION, OFFICE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE PROGRAMS WILL TRANSFER FUNDS TO THE TENNESSEE BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION (TBI) TO AID IN THE STATE'S EFFORTS TO IMPROVE CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORDS.  PHASE I OF TBI'S 5-YEAR CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORD IMPROVEMENT PROJECT IS AN EFFORT TO MODERNIZE AND STANDARDIZE THE METHOD THAT ORIGINAL CHARGE DATA IS COLLECTED FROM THE PRIMARY BOOKING AGENCIES AND REPORTED TO THE REPOSITORY. TASKS WILL INCLUDE: 1) DEVELOPMENT OF THE ARREST CHARGE AND LIVESCAN DATA COLLECTION STANDARDS; 2) REPLACEMENT OF THE DESIGNATED COUNTY BOOKING AGENCY'S LIVESCAN EQUIPMENT THAT HAS AGED PAST THE END OF LIFE; 3) REPLACEMENT OF FIREWALLS INSTALLED WITH EACH LIVESCAN, AS WELL AS REPLACEMENT OF ADDITIONAL FIREWALLS AT LOCAL AND STATE LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES, AND THOSE AT TERMINATION STATIONS; AND 4) PURCHASE OF A 12-MONTH MAINTENANCE AGREEMENT FOR THE NEW LIVESCAN DEVICES. A DROP DOWN MENU OF STANDARDIZED CHARGE INFORMATION WILL BE DEVELOPED IN THE LIVESCAN MACHINES TO IMPROVE HOW THE INFORMATION IS PRESENTED ON THE RAP-SHEET AND TO MAKE FASTER DETERMINATIONS OF DISQUALIFYING ARRESTS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO DEVELOP A STATEWIDE STAKEHOLDERS GROUP TO HELP CREATE AND PROPOSE LEGISLATION FOR IMPLEMENTING A RELIEF FROM DISABILITIES PROGRAM, A REQUIREMENT STATES MUST FULFILL TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR A GRANT UNDER THE NICS ACT RECORD IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM.  TRAVEL FUNDS ARE BEING REQUESTED TO HAVE TWO STAFF MEMBERS ATTEND THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION FOR JUSTICE INFORMATION SYSTEMS (NAJIS) CONFERENCE, AN EVENT THAT FOCUSES ON CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORD MANAGEMENT. (CA/NCF)

prime_award_awarding_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
prime_award_funding_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
prime_awardee_business_types: Nonprofit with 501C3 IRS Status (Other than an Institution of Higher Education)
prime_award_cfda_numbers_and_titles: 93.353: 21ST CENTURY CURES ACT - BEAU BIDEN CANCER MOONSHOT; 93.395: CANCER TREATMENT RESEARCH
subaward_description:
CORE 3: EPIGENOMICS CORE

THIS BROAD INSTITUTE EPIGENOMICS PROGRAM AND GENOMICS PLATFORM WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING SERVICES AND REAGENTS IN SUPPORT OF THE GOALS OF THIS PROPOSAL:

1. CD138+ CELLS WILL BE SUBJECT TO CHIP-SEQ, IN ORDER TO MAP H3K27 ACETYLATION AND POTENTIALLY OTHER FACTORS ON A GENOME WIDE SCALE.  CELLS WILL BE EXTRACTED TO OBTAIN CHROMATIN; CHROMATIN WILL IMMUNOPRECIPITATED USING APPROPRIATE ANTIBODIES; ILLUMINA LIBRARIES WILL BE GENERATED WITHIN THE CORE LAB, AND THEN THEY WILL BE SEQUENCED AT THE BROAD INSTITUTE'S GENOMICS PLATFORM.

2. RAW SEQUENCING RESULTS WILL BE DEMULTIPLEXED AND CONVERTED TO FASTQ FORMAT, ALIGNED TO A GENOME SCAFFOLD TO CREATE BAM FILES, VISUALIZED AS WIGGLE TRACKS IN A SUITABLE GENOME BROWSER, AND SUBJECT TO BOTH MACHINE BASED AND HUMAN ASSISTED QUALITY ASSESSMENT.  STATISTICALLY ENRICHED PEAKS WILL BE MAPPED USING A SEGMENTER SUCH AS HOMER OR MACS2.  DATA FILES WILL BE STORED ON A SERVER WITH BACKUP REDUNDANCY.  DATA FILES WILL BE SHARED WITHIN THE P01 WITH COLLEAGUES IN ONE OR MORE PROJECTS, BY USE OF A PORTAL ENABLING SECURE ACCESS TO RAW DATA FILES BY INVESTIGATORS OUTSIDE OF THE BROAD'S FIREWALL.

CELLS WILL BE EXTRACTED TO OBTAIN CHROMATIN; CHROMATIN WILL IMMUNOPRECIPITATED USING APPROPRIATE ANTIBODIES; ILLUMINA LIBRARIES WILL BE GENERATED WITHIN THE CORE LAB, AND THEN THEY WILL BE SEQUENCED AT THE BROAD INSTITUTE'S GENOMICS PLATFORM.

2. RAW SEQUENCING RESULTS WILL BE DEMULTIPLEXED AND CONVERTED TO FASTQ FORMAT, ALIGNED TO A GENOME SCAFFOLD TO CREATE BAM FILES, VISUALIZED AS WIGGLE TRACKS IN A SUITABLE GENOME BROWSER, AND SUBJECT TO BOTH MACHINE BASED AND HUMAN ASSISTED QUALITY ASSESSMENT.  STATISTICALLY ENRICHED PEAKS WILL BE MAPPED USING A SEGMENTER SUCH AS HOMER OR MACS2.  DATA FILES WILL BE STORED ON A SERVER WITH BACKUP REDUNDANCY.  DATA FILES WILL BE SHARED WITHIN THE P01 WITH COLLEAGUES IN ONE OR MORE PROJECTS, BY USE OF A PORTAL ENABLING SECURE ACCESS TO RAW DATA FILES BY INVESTIGATORS OUTSIDE OF THE BROAD'S FIREWALL.

subaward_description: PROCURE ACCESS POINT EQUIPMENT, SWITCHES AND FIREWALL FOR PAR PREMISES IN COLOMBIA.

PARK COUNTY RECEIVING TWO SEPERATE SUB-AWARDS (CLINT TINSLEY AUTHORIZING OFFICIAL FOR BOTH AWARDS).
1.  PARK COUNTY (PC), CITY OF LIVINGSTON (COL) AND LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT (LE) CYBER SECURITY PROJECT;  PC AND THE COL NEED TO REPLACE THE EXISTING FIREWALL SYSTEM WITH TWO NEW FIREWALL SYSTEMS TO MAXIMIZE APPROPRIATE SECURITY FOR THREE SEPARATE JURISDICTION AND AGENCY NETWORKS (PC, COL AND AREA LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES).  THE INCREASING VOLUME AND SOPHISTICATION OF CYBER SECURITY THREATS-INCLUDING TARGETING PHISHING SCAMS, DATA THEFT AND OTHER ONLINE VULNERABILITIES DEMAND SECURE SYSTEMS AND INFORMATION.  INSTALLATION OF THE PRODUCT AND STAFF TRAINING ARE ALSO PART OF THE PROJECT. SUB-AWARD OF $55,000.00.
2.  PARK COUNTY NORTH HILL PUBLIC SAFETY COMMUNICATIONS INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENT PROJECT;  THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS MANY COMMUNICATION FACILITY AND TRANSMISSION INADEQUACIES AND RESOLVE REPETITIVE ALL-HAZARD PROBLEMS INCLUDING POOR COMMUNICATIONS IN CERTAIN AREAS INCLUDING THE NORTH AREA OF PARK COUNTY AND PARTS OF I-90. THIS AFFECTS BOTH RESPONSE AND RECOVERY MISSION AREAS, INCLUDING EMERGENCY SERVICES NEEDING RADIO COVERAGE DURING RESPONSE AND THE ROAD, FIRE AND LAW ENFORCEMENT DEPARTMENTS NEEDING COVERAGE DURING RECOVERY EFFORTS FOR FIRES, FLOODS, ACCIDENTS, ETC.

subaward_description: DR. MATTHEW NOCK WILL WORK WITH DR. JORDAN SMOLLER AND DR. BEN REIS ON PLANNING AND MANAGING THE RESEARCH PROJECT. DURING THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT, DR. NOCK WILL PLAY AN ACTIVE ROLE IN THE ALGORITHMIC DESIGN, ANALYSIS OF DATA, MODIFICATION OF ANALYSES, INTERPRETATION OF RESULTS AND AID IN THE PRESENTATION OF STUDY RESULTS. WHEN AND IF NECESSARY, DR. NOCK WILL VIEW AND ACCESS DE-IDENTIFIED PARTNERS DATA FROM A VIRTUAL MACHINE BEHIND THE PARTNERS FIREWALL. DR. NOCK WILL NOT REMOVE OR DOWNLOAD DATA TO HARVARD SERVERS.

THE CITY NEEDS TO DEFEND AGAINST UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS.  WE OFFER A VARIETY OF SERVICES SO OUR NETWORK HAS OPENINGS.  WE NEED THE ABILITY TO PROTECT AGAINST THREATS THAT COULD COMPROMISE OUR SYSTEMS ON THE PATHS FOR THE LEGITIMATE TRAFFIC.  THE ADDITION OF A WEB APPLICATION FIREWALL WILL ALLOW US TO SCAN, DETECT AND PATCH A VULNERABILITY WHEN CURRENTLY WE WOULDNÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢T KNOW ABOUT A VULNERABILITY UNLESS A BREACH OCCURS.  IT STAFF CAN MONITOR FOR A THREAT BEFORE IT INFILTRATES THE CITYÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S NETWORK

prime_award_funding_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
prime_awardee_business_types: Public/State Controlled Institution of Higher Education
prime_award_base_transaction_description: Privacy-Aware Federated Learning for Breast Cancer Risk Assessment - ABSTRACT: Federated learning (FL) has gained a lot of attention recently, as it enables analyses of data from numerous collaborating sites without the need to share data, i.e., each collaborator’s data are always retained within their site. FL is advantageous as it can: 1) overcome cultural/ownership, privacy, and regulatory concerns (since data never leave the local site), 2) provide access to restricted data, 3) allow the collection of meaningful amounts of data for analyses of rare diseases, and 4) address health disparities and inequities. Thus, FL can be noted as a novel paradigm for multi-site collaborations, enabling access to ample and importantly diverse data, essential to developing robust models generalizable in unseen data. To this end, we have developed the Federated Tumor Segmentation (FeTS) platform and the Open Federated Learning (OpenFL) library, as open-source tools with a commercially friendly license that have facilitated a) the largest to-date real-world federation, involving 3D brain tumor MRI data from 71 sites across 6 continents, and b) the very first computational challenge in FL, forming the first benchmarking environment and dataset in the field. This FeTS-OpenFL infrastructure has further been used to c) identify tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes in histopathology images and d) segment dense tissue in 2D digital mammography (DM), highlighting its generalizability in different imaging and disease types. Building upon our successful FeTS-OpenFL infrastructure, we propose to enhance its functionality with new developments on privacy-aware FL towards classification workloads and evaluate it on a first-of-its-kind use case on breast cancer (BC) risk assessment. BC is the most diagnosed cancer in the US, the 2nd leading cause of death from cancer in women, and screening is performed routinely with 2D digital mammography (DM) for women in their 40s-50s. However, DM yields a lot of false positives and unnecessary subsequent procedures. To alleviate these issues, 3D Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) has been developed and increasingly replacing DM. Our group has developed novel volumetric breast density (VBD) measures from DBT scans. Building upon our team’s collective pioneering work in FL and BC risk assessment, in this proposal we focus on developing a trustworthy, zero-code principle FL framework for training AI-based classification models and built-in functionality to i) generate realistic synthetic data, matching local population characteristics, for data augmentation & privacy preservation, and ii) automatically determine quantitative & interpretable settings of optimal privacy preservation. We will use this framework to perform the largest to-date evaluation of training deep-learning models for BC risk assessment using DBT VBD measures and other established risk factors while leveraging multi-site, ethnically diverse data of women undergoing BC screening. We will also disseminate resources via distribution of source code, deployment to collaborating sites, and organization of training activities. Our overarching goal is an easy-to-use translatable trustworthy FL framework, lowering the barrier for under-served populations to participate in large- scale FL studies, and paving the way to address health disparities, towards accelerating discovery healthcare.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: Privacy-Aware Federated Learning for Breast Cancer Risk Assessment - ABSTRACT: Federated learning (FL) has gained a lot of attention recently, as it enables analyses of data from numerous collaborating sites without the need to share data, i.e., each collaborator’s data are always retained within their site. FL is advantageous as it can: 1) overcome cultural/ownership, privacy, and regulatory concerns (since data never leave the local site), 2) provide access to restricted data, 3) allow the collection of meaningful amounts of data for analyses of rare diseases, and 4) address health disparities and inequities. Thus, FL can be noted as a novel paradigm for multi-site collaborations, enabling access to ample and importantly diverse data, essential to developing robust models generalizable in unseen data. To this end, we have developed the Federated Tumor Segmentation (FeTS) platform and the Open Federated Learning (OpenFL) library, as open-source tools with a commercially friendly license that have facilitated a) the largest to-date real-world federation, involving 3D brain tumor MRI data from 71 sites across 6 continents, and b) the very first computational challenge in FL, forming the first benchmarking environment and dataset in the field. This FeTS-OpenFL infrastructure has further been used to c) identify tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes in histopathology images and d) segment dense tissue in 2D digital mammography (DM), highlighting its generalizability in different imaging and disease types. Building upon our successful FeTS-OpenFL infrastructure, we propose to enhance its functionality with new developments on privacy-aware FL towards classification workloads and evaluate it on a first-of-its-kind use case on breast cancer (BC) risk assessment. BC is the most diagnosed cancer in the US, the 2nd leading cause of death from cancer in women, and screening is performed routinely with 2D digital mammography (DM) for women in their 40s-50s. However, DM yields a lot of false positives and unnecessary subsequent procedures. To alleviate these issues, 3D Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) has been developed and increasingly replacing DM. Our group has developed novel volumetric breast density (VBD) measures from DBT scans. Building upon our team’s collective pioneering work in FL and BC risk assessment, in this proposal we focus on developing a trustworthy, zero-code principle FL framework for training AI-based classification models and built-in functionality to i) generate realistic synthetic data, matching local population characteristics, for data augmentation & privacy preservation, and ii) automatically determine quantitative & interpretable settings of optimal privacy preservation. We will use this framework to perform the largest to-date evaluation of training deep-learning models for BC risk assessment using DBT VBD measures and other established risk factors while leveraging multi-site, ethnically diverse data of women undergoing BC screening. We will also disseminate resources via distribution of source code, deployment to collaborating sites, and organization of training activities. Our overarching goal is an easy-to-use translatable trustworthy FL framework, lowering the barrier for under-served populations to participate in large- scale FL studies, and paving the way to address health disparities, towards accelerating discovery healthcare.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: Research Infrastructure: Management and Operations of the Ocean Observatories Initiative (OOI 2.5) -The Ocean Observatories Initiative (OOI) is a community-inspired and community-serving research observatory. Its mission is to safely operate and maintain sophisticated arrays of instruments and associated infrastructure that collect, archive, and distribute quality oceanic and marine atmospheric data to the ocean and Earth science communities. OOI measurements provide comprehensive insights into the Earth, ocean, and atmosphere for scientists, educators, students, laypersons, industry, and policymakers. OOI data and derived products improve our understanding of the processes that impact climate variability, ecosystems, fisheries, geohazards, and the subseafloor environment, which in turn advance the capabilities of decision-makers charged with the stewardship of ocean resources. Common and open access to OOI data and resources fosters partnerships between international academic and non-academic organizations. All OOI data are backed up by documented procedures and metadata, distributed freely to users via a common web portal (at www.oceanobservatories.org), and archived. OOI?s open data policies support early career scientists and investigators as well as an array of educational programs. The breadth and depth of capabilities provided by the OOI provide transformative scientific and educational opportunities for the community at large. OOI manages and operates five ocean arrays located at scientifically strategic locations in the open ocean (Global Arrays), shelf waters (Coastal Arrays), and on the seabed (Cabled Array). The Global Irminger Sea Array (off Greenland) provides physical, biological, and chemical measurements of the water column. It captures mesoscale variability and air-sea fluxes in a region of documented deep-water formation, which impacts the Atlantic meridional overturning circulation and changes in ocean heat transport. The Station Papa Array (Gulf of Alaska) quantifies water column properties and mesoscale variability in a region of longstanding scientific interest for studies ranging from ocean circulation and air-sea fluxes to carbon cycling and biological productivity amongst others. In 2024, the Pioneer Array will be relocated to the Mid-Atlantic Bight where it will enable new science and educational opportunities in a high-energy continental shelf environment. Its design will address the influence of the strong western boundary current in this part of the Atlantic as well as terrestrial freshwater inputs to the biologically productive and diverse ecosystems found there. The Regional Cabled Array brings high-power and high-bandwidth capacity, which allows real-time, two-way communications with the oceans. It will continue to provide new insights into interlinked seismic, volcanic, and hydrothermal processes operating off the Oregon coast, the flux of methane from the seafloor, and the seafloor biosphere. The Endurance Array provides interdisciplinary observations within the coastal upwelling region of the Oregon and Washington coasts, provides observations of the eastern boundary current regime at both short and longer, climate-relevant time scales that lead to new insights into shelf/slope nutrient exchange, air-sea property exchange, carbon cycling, and ocean acidification. This renewal award to Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI), for continued operations and management, builds upon the accomplishments of the initial award and incorporates new operational and outreach changes in response to community input. WHOI, the University of Washington (UW), and Oregon State University (OSU) will continue to provide scientific and technical management and operation and maintenance for the next phase of the Ocean Observatories Initiative. The organizational structure of the initial award will be retained with the Program Management Office (PMO) residing at WHOI under the direction of the National Science Foundation. Each of the three institutions will continue to maintain the marine and computing assets for which they are currently responsible; WHOI will operate the Pioneer Array, and the two Global Arrays in the Irminger Sea and at Station Papa, UW will operate the Regional Cabled Array, and OSU will operate the Endurance Array and the Cyberinfrastructure systems, including data ingestion and delivery. Performance metrics for OOI include quantification of scientific output, program management, systems performance, data usage, data quality, and community engagement. This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.- Subawards are planned for this award.
subawardee_business_types: U.S. STATE GOVERNMENT,1862 LAND GRANT COLLEGE,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING,VETERINARY COLLEGE,SCHOOL OF FORESTRY
subaward_description:
COASTAL ENDURANCE ARRAY:  **MANAGEMENT** INCLUDES ENGINEERING OVERSIGHT AND THE MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION OF ARRAY ASSETS, MANAGEMENT AND PILOTING OF GLIDERS AND SYSTEM HEALTH MONITORING OF UNCABLED ENDURANCE ARRAY INFRASTRUCTURE, AND DESIGN CONFIGURATION MANAGEMENT OF THE AS DEPLOYED TECHNICAL DATA PACKAGE. ADDITIONALLY, THIS CATEGORY INCLUDES THE DATA TEAM. THE DATA TEAM PROVIDES QUALITY ASSURANCE AND QUALITY CONTROL OF OOI DATA AND WORKS WITH CYBERINFRASTRUCTURE STAFF ON DELIVERING QUALITY DATA THROUGH OOIÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S WEBSITE WITH APPROPRIATE METADATA AND ANNOTATIONS. **REFURBISHMENT**  INCLUDES COASTAL SURFACE MOORINGS, COASTAL PROFILER MOORINGS, COASTAL SURFACE PIERCING PROFILERS, AND COASTAL GLIDERS. EACH OF THE PLATFORMS REFERENCED ABOVE HAS AN ACTIVITIES-BASED ESTIMATE DEFINING BUILD, INTEGRATE AND TEST COSTS FOR SYSTEMS AND SUBSYSTEMS DEFINED BY THE PROJECT. THE ACTIVITIES-BASED ESTIMATES ARE CONSISTENT WITH ACTUAL YEARLY EXPENDITURES IN THE OOI PROGRAM FROM OOI 2.0 WITH APPROPRIATE ADJUSTMENTS TO OSUÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S CURRENT INSTITUTIONAL RATES AND INDIRECT COST STRUCTURE. **CRUISE** INCLUDE DEPLOYMENTS AND RECOVERIES OF THE ENDURANCE ARRAY PLATFORMS. IT INCLUDES BOTH SHIPBOARD AND NON-SHIPBOARD LABOR SUPPORT. SHIPBOARD LABOR IS BASED ON THE SHIP TIME AND STAFFING NEEDED TO DEPLOY AND RECOVER ENDURANCE ARRAY PLATFORMS. NON-SHIPBOARD LABOR INCLUDES PLANNING, PRE/POST CRUISE PACK, MOBILIZATION OF MOORINGS AND GLIDERS, POST CRUISE DEMOBILIZATION, EQUIPMENT MAINTENANCE, AND SAMPLE PROCESSING.

DATA CENTER: THE OOI DC PROVIDES STORAGE, COMPUTATION, BACKUP, DISASTER RECOVERY, AND CLOUD-LIKE ACCESS FOR THE OOI PROGRAM DATA. THE OOI 2.0 DATA CENTER CONSISTS OF FIVE RACKS THAT HOUSE 5 AND 7-NODE VXRAIL CLUSTERS THAT RUN THE PRODUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT SOFTWARE ENVIRONMENTS, RESPECTIVELY; A 3.8 PB ISILON STORAGE CLUSTER; A ML3 BACKUP TAPE LIBRARY AND 3 ASSOCIATED R440 SERVERS; A 28-NODE C6420 CASSANDRA CLUSTER; A 20-NODE C6420 CLUSTER FOR THE DATA EXPLORER AND JUPYTERHUB ENVIRONMENTS; 2 PALO ALTO FIREWALLS; AND 14 NETWORK SWITCHES. CONSISTENT WITH THE ANNUAL WORK PLAN (AWP), THE DATA CENTER WILL BE REFRESHED IN PYVI TO CONSIST OF FIVE RACKS THAT HOUSE POWERPROTECT CYBER RECOVERY VAULT AND DATA DOMAIN APPLIANCES; A 24-NODE CASSANDRA CLUSTER; A 16-NODE VXRAIL CLUSTER; 2 CORE NETWORK SWITCHES; 2 PALO ALTO FIREWALLS; AND AN 8 PB ISILON STORAGE CLUSTER. ADDITIONALLY, AN 8 PB ELASTIC CLOUD STORAGE (ECS) CLUSTER WILL BE LOCATED IN THE CASCADE DIVIDE DATA CENTER IN BEND, OREGON. THIS ECS CLUSTER WILL PROVIDE A REMOTE, OFFSITE COPY OF THE RAW DATA.
