subaward_description:
AS A WELCOMING CONGREGATION THAT WANTS TO BE "OPEN-ARMED" TO ITS COMMUNITY, THE CHURCH IS OPPOSED TO FENCING AND GATING THE PROPERTY.  THUS, WE WILL IMPROVE THE SECURITY OF OUR CHURCH AND CHILDCARE THROUGH:  (1) THE INSTALLATION OF OUTDOOR AND INDOOR CAMERAS; (2) A NETWORK FIREWALL AND IMPROVEMENTS TO THE NETWORK SYSTEM TO PREVENT CYBER-ATTACKS; AND (3) EXPERT TRAINING FOR CHURCH EMPLOYEES AND VOLUNTEERS.  THESE STEPS WILL SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE THE SECURITY OF THE CHURCH AND ITS ASSOCIATED CHILDCARE, CAREPOINTE ACADEMY.

THE OUTDOOR AND INDOOR SECURITY CAMERA SYSTEM WILL FEATURE 60 CAMERAS THROUGHOUT THE BUILDING'S INTERIOR AND EXTERIOR.  THE CAMERA SYSTEM SERVER WILL HAVE 192TB TO ALLOW 90+ DAYS OF VIDEO STORAGE ONSITE.  THE EXTERIOR CAMERAS WILL BE VANDAL PROOF.  

A NETWORK SECURITY SYSTEM FIREWALL WILL BE INSTALLED TO PREVENT CYBERATTACKS. .  

NETWORKING AND COMPONENT UPGRADES WILL FURTHER SECURE THE CHURCH FROM CYBERATTACKS.  

A INTRUDER AWARENESS AND RESPONSE FOR CHURCHES PLAN AND ITS TRAINING TO IMPLEMENT THE PLAN FOR UP TO 100 ATTENDEES WILL BE PROVIDED BY AN EXPERT TRAINING CONSULTAN.

THE MANAGEMENT/ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS (PROCUREMENT, WEEKLY MEETINGS, ACCOUNTING, ETC) ARE ALSO REQUIRED.
THE POINTE CHURCH IS FORT WAYNE'S FASTEST GROWING CHURCH.  OUTREACH MAGAZINE IN PARTNERSHIP WITH BARNA RESEARCH NAMED THE POINTE CHURCH ONE OF NORTH AMERICA'S TOP 100 FASTEST GROWING CHURCHES.  THE CHURCH HAS A GLOBAL SOCIAL MEDIA AUDIENCE WITH 100,000+ WEEKLY CONGREGANTS WATCHING OUR SERVICES (SOME SERVICES HAVE UP TO 800,000 CONGREGANTS).

ADDITIONALLY, THE CHURCH OPERATES A CHILDCARE MINISTRY FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM MONDAY TO FRIDAY FOR OVER ONE HUNDRED CHILDREN.
THE POINTE CHURCH HAS DEVELOPED PREPARATION PLANS AND TRAINING MATERIALS FOR STORMS, INCLUDING TORNADOS.  THE CHILDCARE MINISTRY CONDUCTS MONTHLY FIRE DRILLS IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT.  THE CHURCH AND CHILDCARE UTILIZE AN ACCESS CONTROL SYSTEM AND, IN THE PAST, UTILIZED A VERY BASIC CAMERA MONITORING IN THE LOBBY SPACES.
THE CHURCH IDENTIFIED 3 TYPES OF THREATS: (1) INSIDERS, SUCH AS MEMBERS OR DAYCARE FAMILIES, WHO ARE DISENCHANTED OR UPSET WITH THE CHURCH OR DAYCARE; (2) OUTSIDERS WITH PAST TIES TO THE CHURCH, LIKE FORMER EMPLOYEES, MEMBERS, OR THOSE WHO HAVE RECEIVED ASSISTANCE, WHO NOW HOLD GRIEVANCES; AND (3) STRANGERS OR GROUPS OPPOSED TO THE CHRISTIAN FAITH, AIMING TO MAKE A ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã…Â€ŒSTATEMENTÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã¯Â¿Â½ BY TARGETING THE CHURCH OR DAYCARE. RECOGNIZING THESE RISKS HELPS THE CHURCH PROACTIVELY ADDRESS SAFETY AND SECURITY.
THE POINTE CHURCH, WITH 3,000+ MEMBERS ON A HIGH-SPEED ROAD, COULD BE A TARGET FOR EXTREMISTS. ITS DAYCARE, CAREPOINTE ACADEMY, SERVES 100+ CHILDREN AND LACKS FENCING, OUTDOOR CAMERAS, AND CONSISTENT ACCESS CONTROL, WHICH IS TURNED OFF ON SUNDAYS TO REMAIN OPEN. SECURITY IS MINIMAL, WITH NO PERSONNEL, LIMITED NETWORK PROTECTION, AND OUTDATED CAMERAS. IMPROVED PLANNING, TRAINING, AND SECURITY MEASURES ARE URGENTLY NEEDED TO ENSURE SAFETY.
IF THE CHURCH OR ITS CHILDCARE WERE TARGETED BY EXTREMISTS, 5 EFFECTS ARE LIKELY: (1) FEAR WOULD LEAD ATTENDEES AND DAYCARE FAMILIES TO LEAVE; (2) THE DISRUPTION COULD BANKRUPT AND SHUT DOWN THE ORGANIZATION; (3) LEADERSHIP MIGHT LOSE RESPECT IN THE COMMUNITY FOR FAILING TO PREVENT THE ATTACK; (4) SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS COULD BE AFFECTED AS THE PUBLIC AVOIDS CHURCHES AND CHILDCARES; AND (5) BOTH THE CHURCH AND CHILDCARE WOULD SUFFER DUE TO THEIR INTERTWINED REPUTATION AND FINANCIAL DEPENDENCE.

A COMPLETE ANALYSIS OF FALLON COUNTY I.T. PROCESSES DONE. FALLON COUNTY HAS 8 DISTINCT I.T. USER LOCATIONS, AND I WILL LIST THEM NOW. 1. MAIN COURTHOUSE, 2. AIRPORT, 3. GUN RANGE, 4. COUNTY SHOP, 5. COUNTY LANDFILL, 6. PUBLIC HEALTH DEPT., 7. SENIOR CITIZENS CENTER, 8. COUNTY GOLF COURSE. A REVIEW NEEDS TO BE DONE FOR PORTALS, FIREWALLS, BACKUPS, AND A METHOD TO MONITOR TRAFFIC

prime_award_base_transaction_description: Renal Osteodystrophy Precision Medicine Project - (PLEASE KEEP IN WORD, DO NOT PDF) Renal osteodystrophy (ROD) is a complex disorder of bone metabolism that affects virtually all adults with chronic kidney disease (CKD). ROD is associated with adverse clinical outcomes including bone loss, mineralization and turnover abnormalities, skeletal deformities, fractures, cardiovascular events and death. Despite current therapies, fracture incidence is 2- to 100-fold higher in adults with compared to those without CKD. Limited knowledge of ROD pathogenesis impedes development of therapeutics aimed at reducing morbidity and mortality of CKD patients. Bone-tissue based information obtained from patients with ROD that includes altered epigenome and transcriptome as a function of disease progression is missing and highly contributes to this critical knowledge gap. Our long-term goal is to close this knowledge gap by creating the fundamental infrastructure to facilitate high-impact novel hypothesis-driven clinical and translational research in ROD by building a large-scale data and tissue biorepository integrating clinical, bone quality, transcriptomic and epigenomic data along with stored urine, blood and bone samples. To this effect, we aim to obtain robust and necessary preliminary data assessing the variability and demonstrating the rigor and reliability of single nuclei sequencing in bone by simultaneous profiling of the transcriptome (using 3’ gene expression) and epigenome (using ATACseq) to deepen our understanding of how genes are expressed and regulated across different cells and ROD types and kidney disease stages. Our hypothesis is that this initial and critical step will support and justify the establishment of a comprehensive open-access NIH-funded database to share bone-tissue based information obtained from patients with ROD with the broad scientific community. Such a resource will provide the underpinnings for future research endeavors leading to the elucidation of the pathogenesis of ROD in CKD patients with and without dialysis. Successful completion of these studies represents a crucial milestone in the process of discovering new information regarding unrecognized bone changes that have severe clinical complications. These goals will be executed by: (1) Collecting bone biopsies for phenotyping ROD from 12 adults with CKD 3-5D (n=4/stage) and a reference population of 4 kidney-healthy adults with age-related osteoporosis (Aim 1); (2) Determining changes in osseous transcriptome and epigenome of patients with ROD vs osteoporosis at the cellular level using single nuclei RNA and ATAC sequencing (Aim 2); and (3) Developing a user pipeline for the resource by: 1) promoting the resource via social media, major national and international societies across a broad spectrum of specialties and review articles and manuscripts published in major subspecialty journals; 2) collecting metrics and tracking information on data downloads, publications and grant applications; and 3) developing an interactive open access web-based interface (Aim 3). These results will contribute to our efforts to redefine our understanding of ROD pathogenesis and pathophysiology and the development of disease targeted prevention strategies.
prime_award_cfda_numbers_and_titles: 93.847: DIABETES, DIGESTIVE, AND KIDNEY DISEASES EXTRAMURAL RESEARCH
subawardee_business_types: U.S. STATE GOVERNMENT,1862 LAND GRANT COLLEGE,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
SCOPE OF WORK - UCLA
PROJECT BACKGROUND AND NEED FOR SUBAWARD
CHILDHOOD AND ADOLESCENCE ARE CRUCIAL TIMES FOR DEVELOPMENT OF HEALTHY SKELETAL AND 
CARDIOVASCULAR SYSTEMS. CHILDREN WITH CHRONIC KIDNEY DISEASE (CKD) ARE PLAGUED BY 
CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE, ANEMIA, AND BONE DISEASE, WITH FRACTURES RATES THAT ARE 2- TO 3-FOLD 
HIGHER THAN IN HEALTHY CHILDREN. FURTHERMORE, MORE THAN 50% OF ADULTS WHO DEVELOPED KIDNEY 
DISEASE IN CHILDHOOD REPORT SKELETAL SYMPTOMS, WITH 20% REPORTING HANDICAPS FROM THEIR BONE 
DISEASE, DESPITE TREATMENT WITH PHOSPHATE BINDERS AND ACTIVE VITAMIN D CONSEQUENCE OF A 
LIFELONG PROCESS. CURRENTLY, THERE IS A LACK OF LARGE-SCALE DATABASES CONTAINING DATA FROM DEEP 
PHENOTYPING OF PATIENTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM OF ROD. THIS PROPOSAL WILL GENERATE A BIOREPOSITORY 
OF HUMAN BIOLOGICAL SPECIMENS AND THE ACCOMPANYING ANALYTICAL INFRASTRUCTURE ESSENTIAL FOR 
REDEFINING, ELUCIDATING AND CHARACTERIZING THE PATHOGENESIS OF ROD IN CKD PEDIATRIC PATIENTS 
WITH AND WITHOUT DIALYSIS AND INFORMING THE DEVELOPING OF NOVEL DISEASE MODIFYING OR 
PREVENTATIVE THERAPIES.
BONE BIOPSY
BONE BIOPSY WILL BE PERFORMED IN THOSE PATIENTS THAT WILL AGREE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE STUDY. AFTER 
DOUBLE TETRACYCLINE LABELING, THE SPECIMEN OF BONE WILL BE OBTAINED WITH A BORDIER BONE BIOPSY 
TREPHINE UNDER SEDATION MONITORED BY AN ANESTHESIOLOGIST WITH WHOM DR. SALUSKY HAVE BEEN 
WORKING FOR MORE THAN TWO DECADES. QUANTITATIVE HISTOMORPHOMETRY WILL BE PERFORMED 
(OSTEOMETRIC INC., ATLANTA, GA) AT THE UCLA BONE HISTOMORPHOMETRY LABORATORY DIRECTED BY DR. 
RENATA PEREIRA. REFERENCE VALUES FROM SUBJECTS WITH NORMAL RENAL FUNCTION HAVE BEEN OBTAINED 
FROM ILIAC CREST BONE BIOPSIES AFTER DOUBLE TETRACYCLINE LABELLING IN 29 CHILDREN AND YOUNG ADULTS 
BETWEEN THE AGES OF 2.5 AND 32 YEARS WHO HAVE UNDERGONE ELECTIVE ORTHOPEDIC OR UROLOGICAL 
SURGERY PROCEDURES. THE NOMENCLATURE ESTABLISHED BY THE AMERICAN SOCIETY OF BONE AND 
MINERAL RESEARCH AS WELL AS THE NEW CLASSIFICATION OF RENAL OSTEODYSTROPHY WILL BE USED FOR THE 
REPORTING OF ALL RESULTS. THE BONE IMMUNOHISTOCHEMICAL TECHNIQUE AND PROTEIN QUANTIFICATION BY 
ARIOL SCANNING WILL BE PERFORMED AS PREVIOUSLY REPORTED BY THE UCLA TEAM.56,62
APPLICATION OF IMMUNOHISTOCHEMISTRY, WESTERN BLOT AND RNA ANALYSIS, AS WELL AS TUNEL 
STAINING, TO HUMAN BONE BIOPSIES WILL PROVIDE A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY TO EXPLORE DIFFERENT ASPECTS 
OF ROD. THE BONE BIOPSY PROCEDURE HAS BEEN WIDELY UTILIZED EXTENSIVELY AT UCLA, IT IS WELL 
TOLERATED AND WITH MINIMA; DISCOMFORT. OVER THE YEARS, A SUBSTANTIAL PROPORTION OF PATIENTS HAVE 
UNDERGONE A REPEAT BONE BIOPSY AS PART OF DIFFERENT PROTOCOLS.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: Renal Osteodystrophy Precision Medicine Project - (PLEASE KEEP IN WORD, DO NOT PDF) Renal osteodystrophy (ROD) is a complex disorder of bone metabolism that affects virtually all adults with chronic kidney disease (CKD). ROD is associated with adverse clinical outcomes including bone loss, mineralization and turnover abnormalities, skeletal deformities, fractures, cardiovascular events and death. Despite current therapies, fracture incidence is 2- to 100-fold higher in adults with compared to those without CKD. Limited knowledge of ROD pathogenesis impedes development of therapeutics aimed at reducing morbidity and mortality of CKD patients. Bone-tissue based information obtained from patients with ROD that includes altered epigenome and transcriptome as a function of disease progression is missing and highly contributes to this critical knowledge gap. Our long-term goal is to close this knowledge gap by creating the fundamental infrastructure to facilitate high-impact novel hypothesis-driven clinical and translational research in ROD by building a large-scale data and tissue biorepository integrating clinical, bone quality, transcriptomic and epigenomic data along with stored urine, blood and bone samples. To this effect, we aim to obtain robust and necessary preliminary data assessing the variability and demonstrating the rigor and reliability of single nuclei sequencing in bone by simultaneous profiling of the transcriptome (using 3’ gene expression) and epigenome (using ATACseq) to deepen our understanding of how genes are expressed and regulated across different cells and ROD types and kidney disease stages. Our hypothesis is that this initial and critical step will support and justify the establishment of a comprehensive open-access NIH-funded database to share bone-tissue based information obtained from patients with ROD with the broad scientific community. Such a resource will provide the underpinnings for future research endeavors leading to the elucidation of the pathogenesis of ROD in CKD patients with and without dialysis. Successful completion of these studies represents a crucial milestone in the process of discovering new information regarding unrecognized bone changes that have severe clinical complications. These goals will be executed by: (1) Collecting bone biopsies for phenotyping ROD from 12 adults with CKD 3-5D (n=4/stage) and a reference population of 4 kidney-healthy adults with age-related osteoporosis (Aim 1); (2) Determining changes in osseous transcriptome and epigenome of patients with ROD vs osteoporosis at the cellular level using single nuclei RNA and ATAC sequencing (Aim 2); and (3) Developing a user pipeline for the resource by: 1) promoting the resource via social media, major national and international societies across a broad spectrum of specialties and review articles and manuscripts published in major subspecialty journals; 2) collecting metrics and tracking information on data downloads, publications and grant applications; and 3) developing an interactive open access web-based interface (Aim 3). These results will contribute to our efforts to redefine our understanding of ROD pathogenesis and pathophysiology and the development of disease targeted prevention strategies.

subaward_description:
SCOPE OF WORK 
CONSORTIUM INSTITUTION: 
CONSORTIUM INVESTIGATOR: HARTMUT MALLUCHE, MD
PROPOSED PROJECT DATES: 10/01/2022-09/30/2024
PROJECT BACKGROUND AND NEED FOR SUBAWARD
MITIGATION AND PREVENTION OF MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY DUE TO RENAL OSTEODYSTROPHY (ROD) IS IMPEDED BY THE 
LACK OF LARGE-SCALE DATABASES CONTAINING DATA FROM DEEP PHENOTYPING OF PATIENTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM OF 
ROD. THIS PROPOSAL AIMS TO OBTAIN ROBUST AND NECESSARY PRELIMINARY DATA FOR OUR RC2 BY ASSESSING THE 
VARIABILITY AND DEMONSTRATING THE RIGOR AND RELIABILITY OF SINGLE NUCLEI SEQUENCING IN BONE BY SIMULTANEOUS 
PROFILING OF THE TRANSCRIPTOME (USING 3ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã¢Â€ŽÂ¢ GENE EXPRESSION) AND EPIGENOME (USING ATACSEQ) TO DEEPEN OUR 
UNDERSTANDING OF HOW GENES ARE EXPRESSED AND REGULATED ACROSS DIFFERENT CELLS AND ROD TYPES AND KIDNEY 
DISEASE STAGES. SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THESE STUDIES REPRESENTS A CRUCIAL MILESTONE IN THE PROCESS OF 
DISCOVERING NEW INFORMATION REGARDING UNRECOGNIZED BONE CHANGES THAT HAVE SEVERE CLINICAL 
COMPLICATIONS. THESE GOALS WILL BE EXECUTED ACCORDING TO THE REQUESTED BUDGET, WITH DR. MALLUCHEÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã¢Â€ŽÂ¢S ROLE 
OUTLINED BELOW. 
BONE BIOPSY
BONE BIOPSY WILL BE PERFORMED ON THE PATIENTS AGREEING TO PARTICIPATE TO THE STUDY. TWO TETRACYCLINE 
COMPOUNDS (TETRACYCLINE HYDROCHLORIDE AND DEMECLOCYCLINE HYDROCHLORIDE) WILL BE USED TO DISTINGUISH TIMED 
BONE LABELS. TETRACYCLINE HYDROCHLORIDE GIVES A YELLOW COLOR AND DEMECLOCYCLINE HYDROCHLORIDE 
(DECLOMYCINÃƑÂ€ŠÃ‚Â®, LEDERLE, WAYNE, NJ), A GOLDEN-YELLOWISH FLUORESCENCE UNDER FLUORESCENT LIGHT MICROSCOPY. 
THE LABELING SCHEDULE CONSISTS OF A 2-DAY ORAL ADMINISTRATION OF DEMECLOCYCLINE HYDROCHLORIDE (150 MG BID) 
FOLLOWED BY A DRUG-FREE INTERVAL OF 10 DAYS AND SUBSEQUENT ORAL ADMINISTRATION OF TETRACYCLINE HYDROCHLORIDE 
(250 MG BID) FOR 4 DAYS. THE BONE BIOPSY WILL BE PERFORMED 2-4 DAYS AFTER THE LAST TETRACYCLINE DOSE. THIS 
DOSING REGIMEN IS ADJUSTED FOR CKD-5D PATIENTS. THE STUDY COORDINATOR WILL PROVIDE STUDY PARTICIPANTS WITH 
A CALENDAR INDICATING THE DATE OF THE BONE BIOPSY AND DATES ON WHICH THE COMPOUNDS SHOULD BE TAKEN AND 
CALL STUDY PARTICIPANTS ON THE RESPECTIVE DATES TO REMIND THEM TO TAKE THE MEDICATION. THE BIOPSY WILL BE 
PERFORMED UNDER SEDATION (OR GENERAL ANESTHESIA AS DEEMED NECESSARY BY THE UK ANESTHESIOLOGIST). 
ADDITIONAL LOCAL ANESTHESIA USING LIDOCAINE 1% WILL BE USED. BONE SAMPLES WILL BE TAKEN FROM THE ANTERIOR 
ILIAC CREST USING A VERTICAL APPROACH. THIS BIOPSY TECHNIQUE HAS BEEN USED EXTENSIVELY IN CKD PATIENTS AND 
IS RAPID AND MINIMALLY INVASIVE WITH AN ACCEPTABLE DEGREE OF DISCOMFORT. 
BIOSPECIMEN PROCESSING, STORAGE, AND/OR SHIPMENT
TWO SEPARATE BONE BIOPSY CORES WILL BE COLLECTED FROM EACH STUDY PATIENT. BONES SAMPLES WILL BE COLLECTED FOR 
ANALYSIS BY UK BDRL (TO BE RECEIVED AND ANALYZED BY UK) AND A SEPARATE BONE SAMPLE FOR TRANSCRIPTOMIC AND 
EPIGENOMIC ANALYSES (TO BE SHIPPED FROM UK TO NORTHWESTERN UNIVERSITY).
ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ BONE SAMPLES THAT ARE TO BE SHIPPED WILL BE FLASH FROZEN VIA LIQUID NITROGEN IMMEDIATELY AFTER BIOPSY 
COLLECTION AND THEN SENT TO THE UK BONE DIAGNOSTIC AND RESEARCH LABORATORY (BDRL). BONE SAMPLES WILL 
BE STORED AT -80ÃƑÂ¯Ã¢Â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â°C IN THE BDRL BIOREPOSITORY, ROOM MN564. SAMPLES ARE REGISTERED AND ORGANIZED VIA 
A DATABASE WHICH IS STORED ON A SHARED NETWORK DRIVE AND BACKED UP NIGHTLY. THE SERVERS ARE PROTECTED 
BY THE UK RESEARCH FIREWALL AND ARE IN CLIMATE-CONTROLLED ROOMS WITH EMERGENCY POWER BACKUP AND 
EXTREME FIRE PROTECTION. BONE BIOPSY SAMPLES TO BE SHIPPED WILL BE SENT VIA OVERNIGHT CARRIER ON DRY ICE 
TO NORTHWESTERN UNIVERSITY. 
ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ THE SECOND SET OF BONE SAMPLES WILL BE RECEIVED AT THE UK BDRL AND WILL BE PROCESSED FOR UNDECALCIFIED 
SECTIONING AND EVALUATION OF BONE. UPON RECEIPT OF SPECIMENS AT UK, AN IDENTIFICATION CODE IS ASSIGNED 
TO THE PATIENT AND A RECORD IS STARTED IN THE DATABANK. IDENTIFIERS WILL BE INCLUDED ON THE SPECIMEN LABELING 
AND IN THE DATABANK FOR REDUCTION OF ERROR FOLLOWING THE CAP PROTOCOL, BUT ONLY ACCESSIBLE BY CENTERAPPROVED PERSONNEL. NO PATIENT IDENTIFIERS WILL BE GIVEN TO OUTSIDE RESEARCHERS. THE SAMPLES WILL BE 
PROCESSED FOR ANALYSIS UNDER BRIGHTFIELD LIGHT MICROSCOPY, POLARIZED LIGHT MICROSCOPY, AND FLORESCENT LIGHT 
MICROSCOPY.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: Statistical methods for longitudinal integrated mechanistic modeling of multiview data - Abstract  In longitudinal neuroimaging studies, modeling within-subject variation across time offers insights about time- dependent effects and causal relationships in brain changes related to neurodevelopment, neurodegeneration, or disease progression. Uncovering and quantifying the multi-way relationship across modalities, including environ- mental, *omics, imaging, and neurocognitive data, will help better understand the mechanisms behind complex diseases, such as the impact of substance abuse on neurodevelopment and Alzheimer's Disease. Considering genetic, demographic, and phenotypic traits, it is crucial to characterize disease heterogeneity, such as sex- related differences, for precision medicine. Though methods to perform longitudinal and path analysis of univari- ate data can be applied to individual data elements, limited methods are available directly for data with structured constraints and integrated analysis of large datasets. The long-term goal of this proposal is to develop novel statistical methodologies to analyze longitudinal high-dimensional data with mathematical constraints and novel generalized path analysis methodologies to integrate complex data collected from multiple sources, with appli- cation to the study of neurodevelopment/neurodegeneration and related mental disorders. The overall objective is to elucidate longitudinal effects on brain structure and function, to characterize population heterogeneity, to understand the role of different modalities and mechanisms, and to provide guidance on personalized early prevention/intervention strategies. The challenges of longitudinal integrated mechanistic modeling of multiview data include (i) longitudinal modeling of variables with complex structure (e.g. positive denite matrices), (ii) high dimensionality and heterogeneity, (iii) delineation of multiple pathways, and (iv) development of large-scale and computationally efcient algorithms. To address these, three specic aims are proposed: (1) develop novel regression frameworks for multiple longitudinal, high-dimensional covariance matrix outcomes with predictors across modalities; (2) develop big-data path analysis with longitudinal, high-dimensional, complex variables; (3) develop statistical methodologies to characterize individual growth trajectories of complex variables. Aim 1 introduces longitudinal models with covariance matrices as the outcome to investigate changes in data struc- ture and/or characteristics at a network level. Aim 2 innovates path regularization and integrated optimization criteria for high-dimensional structured data to identify markers and search for causal pathways under longitudi- nal settings. Aim 3 develops methodologies to guide personalized prevention/intervention strategies. To foster dissemination, repeatability, reproducibility, and replicability of scientic ndings, open-source software will be developed. The proposed research is innovative because it proposes methodologies to perform longitudinal and path analysis for high-dimensional data with complex and specic structures collected from multiple domains. The proposed research is signicant because it will enrich the understanding of the human brain and guide practitioners to promote well-being in adolescent and elderly populations.

TOMOSYNTHESIS IMAGES WILL BE PERFORMED UNDER THE LEADERSHIP OF DR. ANNE MARIE MCCARTHY. IN PARTICULAR DR.
MCCARTHY AND HER RESEARCH GROUP WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR: 1) COLLECTING ALL SCANS; 2) STORING THE RECEIVED
IMAGING DATA IN A HIPAA-COMPLIANT RESEARCH PICTURE AND IMAGE ARCHIVING (PACS) DATABASE AND BEHIND SECURE
PENNMEDICINE FIREWALL; 3) APPLYING VALIDATED COMPUTER ALGORITHMS DEVELOPED BY DR. MCCARTHY AND HER GROUP
AND PERFORM FEDERATED IMPLEMENTATION; 4) SHARE ALL THE OBTAINED RESULTS WITH INDIANA UNIVERSITY DATA
COORDINATING CENTER TO PERFORM STATISTICAL ANALYSIS AND HYPOTHESIS TESTING; AND 5) DATA INTERPRETATION AND
MANUSCRIPT DEVELOPMENT.
ALL STUDY INVESTIGATORS AND STAFF MEMBERS WILL WORK TOGETHER ON A REGULAR BASIS TO ENSURE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF
STANDARDIZED STUDY PROTOCOLS AND QUALITY CONTROL PROCEDURES. ALL KEY INVESTIGATORS WILL ALSO PARTICIPATE IN REGULAR
CONFERENCE CALLS TO DISCUSS DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS, BREAST DENSITY MEASURES, AND HYPOTHESIS TESTING.

subawardee_business_types: NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
INDIANA UNIVERSITY WORKING WITH THE REGENSTRIEF INSTITUTE WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL AND SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE FOR THE PROJECT. THEY WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTAINING THE INFRASTRUCTURE FOR IDENTIFYING AND FILTERING PATHOLOGY, CLINICAL, AND DIAGNOSTIC RADIOLOGY REPORTS FROM INDIANAÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S HIE FOR ROUTING TO THE KCR. THIS WILL REQUIRE CONTINUING INPUT FROM SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS (SMES) AT KCR FOR GUIDANCE ON THE RULES FOR EXTRACTING THE CORRECT REPORTS FROM THE HIE. THEY WILL ALSO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTAINING THE PATHWAY FOR ROUTING THE IDENTIFIED REPORTS FROM THE INITIAL EXTRACT THROUGH DMZS, FIREWALLS, ETC TO THE FINAL INTERFACE THAT BRIDGES THE INPC AND KCR. REGENSTRIEF WILL COLLABORATE WITH CO-INVESTIGATORS AND STAFF AT THE KCR TO DEVELOP NEW FILTERING TECHNIQUES FOCUSED ON DIAGNOSTIC RADIOLOGY REPORTS. REGENSTRIEF WILL SHARE LESSONS, PROCESSES, TECHNIQUES, AND SOFTWARE DEVELOPED UNDER THE AUSPICES OF THIS GRANT WITH THE COLLABORATION TEAM, THE CDC, AND OTHER STATE REGISTRIES. PUBLICATIONS, REPORTS, ETC. ARE ALSO VERY NORMAL WORK PRODUCTS FOR 
REGENSTRIEF AND THEY WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THOSE AND TAKE THE LEAD ON SOME AS THE PROJECT UNFOLDS.

subawardee_business_types: U.S. LOCAL GOVERNMENT,MUNICIPALITY,COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION,COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS
subaward_description: THE TEXOMA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENT'S FY21 SHSP CYBERSECURITY ENHANCEMENT PROJECT WILL PROVIDE REPLACEMENTS AND UPDATES TO EXISTING FIREWALLS THAT INCLUDE A CONTINGENCY BACK-UP FIREWALL IN CASE OF FAILURE TO PROTECT INFORMATION FROM FUTURE CYBER ATTACKS.  CURRENT EQUIPMENT IS AT THE END OF LIFE AND IS INADEQUATE TO MEET THE NEEDS OF LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IN COOKE COUNTY AND GRAYSON COUNTY.

THE CITY OF ORANGE MANAGE FIREWALL SERVICES ENTRY POINT PROTECTION AND BACK-UP DISASTER RECOVERY SERVICES PROJECT WILL PURCHASE A BARRACUDA NETWORKS MANAGED FIREWALL SERVICES AND BACKUP DISASTER INCLUDING ANNUAL CONTRACT.  THIS FUNDING WILL ENABLE ALL THE MUNICIPALITIES TO HAVE THEIR INTERNET ENTRY POINTS MONITORED FOR TERRORISTIC CYBER ATTACKS AND ENHANCE CYBER SECURITY WITH PROVIDED BARRACUDA NETWORKS ENHANCED FIREWALL EQUIPMENT.

THE CITY OF HOUSTON'S PUBLIC SAFETY VIDEO ENHANCEMENTS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ENHANCEMENTS TO THE PUBLIC SAFETY VIDEO PROGRAM THROUGH THE PURCHASE OF SURVEILLANCE CAMERAS AND NETWORKING EQUIPMENT. THE ENHANCEMENTS WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH THE USE OF CONTRACTED ENGINEERING, CONFIGURATION, TROUBLESHOOTING AND REPLACEMENT OF VIDEO COMPONENTS INCLUDING WIRELESS RADIO EQUIPMENT, NETWORK SWITCHES AND FIREWALLS TO UPGRADE AGING, END-OF-SUPPORT EQUIPMENT.

HILL COUNTY CYBER SECURITY FIREWALL PROJECT WILL PURCHASE 2 NETWORK FIREWALL SYSTEMS FOR HILL COUNTY EMPLOYEES. THE NEW NETWORK FIREWALL SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE PROTECTION FROM RANSOMWARE, MALICIOUS ATTACKS AGAINST THE COUNTY NETWORK AND WILL SCAN FOR ANY POTENTIAL CYBER THREATS.

subaward_description:
SPECIFIC AIM 1. TO CONTINUE DEVELOPMENT OF THE CATS AND DOGS TASK FOR USE AS A COGNITIVE VITAL SIGN. CURRENTLY, THE TASK IS OPERATIONAL WITH MODIFIABLE LEVELS OF THE TASK AND DATA COLLECTION THAT IS ENCRYPTED AND SENT VIA JSON FILES TO A SERVER HOSTED WITHIN THE BIDMC FIREWALL THROUGH AMAZON WEB SERVICES. ADDITIONAL STEPS INCLUDE FURTHER REFINEMENT OF THE DESIGN, IMPROVED INSTRUCTIONS FOR FIRST-TIME USE, AND ADDITIONAL COLLECTION OF EXACT TOUCH COORDINATES.
SPECIFIC AIM 2. TO IMPLEMENT THE TASK IN THE ELECTROCONVULSIVE THERAPY CLINIC AND IN THE INTENSIVE CARE
UNIT (ICU) SETTING, WHERE PATIENTS ROUTINELY DEVELOP COGNITIVE DEFICITS SUCH AS DELIRIUM AND REQUIRE SERIAL MONITORING. WE HAVE ESTABLISHED COLLABORATIONS WITH KERRY BLOOMINGDALE, MD, THE HEAD OF THE ECT CLINIC AT BIDMC, AND WITH BRIAN OÃƑÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½GARA, MD, AN ICU ATTENDING AT BIDMC WHO HAS A RESEARCH INTEREST IN DELIRIUM.
SPECIFIC AIM 3. TO USE MACHINE LEARNING AND PREDICTIVE ANALYTICS TO REFINE AN ALGORITHM FOR SCORING THE CATS AND DOGS TASK, USING A ÃƑÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½GOLD STANDARDÃƑÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ BATTERY OF ATTENTIONAL TASKS. WE HAVE ESTABLISHED A COLLABORATION WITH KALYAN VEERAMACHANENI AN EXPERT IN MACHINE LEARNING AND PREDICTIVE ANALYTICS.

prime_award_cfda_numbers_and_titles: 93.103: FOOD AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION - RESEARCH; 93.103: FOOD AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION RESEARCH; 93.103: FOOD AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION_RESEARCH
subawardee_business_types: PRIVATE UNIVERSITY OR COLLEGE,NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description:
THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO PROTOTYPE A CHATGPT-LIKE TOOL FOR FDA REVIEWERS IN THE AREA OF BIOEQUIVALENCE (BE).
WE WILL TAKE ADVANTAGE OF AVAILABLE OPEN-SOURCE LARGE LANGUAGE MODELS (LLMS) AND PUBLICLY AVAILABLE FDA REGULATORY
SCIENCE BIOEQUIVALENCE DATA TO GENERATE BOTH MANUAL TRAINING DATA (I.E. EXAMPLES OF INPUTS AND DESIRED OUTPUTS) AS
WELL AS SYNTHETIC, AUTOMATICALLY GENERATED TRAINING DATA BY PUBLICLY AVAILABLE LLMS. WE WILL USE THESE TO BUILD SPECIAL
PURPOSE LLMS WITH SPECIFIC CAPABILITIES OF USE TO FDA BE REVIEWERS. THERE IS ALREADY SOME PRECEDENT FOR USING THESE
APPROACHES FOR ACHIEVING GOOD PERFORMANCE ON TEXTUAL SUMMARIZATION, DETECTION OF DISCREPANCIES.
THE ANALYSIS OF TABULAR DATA IS JUST EMERGING FOR LLMS, BUT EARLY REPORTS SUGGEST STRAIGHTFORWARD APPROACHES THAT TAKE
ADVANTAGE OF CAPABILITIES OF LLMS FOR TEXT. THE ANALYSIS OF IMAGES IS THE MOST RISKY/CHALLENGING PART OF THIS WORK; WE
WILL WORK WITH FDA COLLABORATORS TO TEXT EMERGING ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã…Â€ŒMULTI-MODALÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã¯Â¿Â½ FOUNDATION MODELS THAT ARE OPEN SOURCE AND CAN BE
FINE-TUNED USING SPECIFIC DATA OF INTEREST TO THE FDA (E.G. PK CURVES). WE WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH FDA SCIENTISTS
AND THE STANFORD CENTER FOR RESEARCH ON FOUNDATION MODELS TO PROTOTYPE THESE TOOLS, CREATE EVALUATION SETS, PUBLISH
OUR RESULTS, AND TRANSFER ASSETS TO FDA FOR INTERNAL USE/TESTING.
THE FDA CALL FOR PROPOSALS OUTLINED SEVERAL CAPABILITIES:
1. SUMMARIZATION: THE CFP GAVE SEVERAL EXAMPLES OF SUMMARIZATION TASKS (BE STUDY SUMMARIZED TO 10 KEY
POINTS, ADME PROPERTIES OF A DRUG, CRITICAL QUALITY ATTRIBUTES FOR DRUG). THESE SHOULD BE WELL-WITHIN THE CAPABILITIES OF A
FINE-TUNED LLM. THE KEY CHALLENGE WILL BE ENGINEERING THE APPROPRIATE PROMPTS, PROVIDING PUBLICLY AVAILABLE DATA WITH
WHICH TO FINE-TUNE THE LLM, AND EVALUATION OF HALLUCINATION TENDENCIES.
2. NLP APPLICATION TO EXTRACT/ORGANIZE INFORMATION FROM IMAGES. THIS IS MORE CHALLENGING SINCE THE ANALYSIS OF
IMAGES REQUIRES NOT AN LLM BUT A ÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã…Â€ŒFOUNDATION MODELÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã¯Â¿Â½ (FM) WHICH COMBINES TEXT AND IMAGE. PART OF OUR PROPOSAL
THEREFORE IS TO INVESTIGATE THE AVAILABILITY OF TRAINING DATA FOR THIS TASK (PAIRED IMAGES AND INTERPRETATIONS) AND THE
VOLUME OF THESE. WE ANTICIPATE THAT WE WILL EXPERIMENT WITH AVAILABLE MULTI-MODAL FMS TO ASSESS THEIR CAPABILITIES IN
EXTRACTING PHARMACOKINETIC DATA FROM IMAGES. FOR EXAMPLE, MACAW-LLM PROVIDES AN OPEN-SOURCE ARCHITECTURE FOR
TEXT, IMAGE, AUDIO AND VIDEO WHICH WE CAN EVALUATE [5]. THERE ARE OTHER SUCH PLATFORMS EMERGING THAT WE WILL
EVALUATE.
3. NLP CAPTURE OF INFORMATION IN TABLES IN WORD/PDF. THIS IS AN EMERGING AREA WITH SOME REPORTS OF INITIAL
PROGRESS [6]. REMARKABLY, THE BEST WAY FOR PROCESSING TEXT IS OFTEN TO TURN IT INTO TEXT SENTENCE ASSERTIONS, AND THEN
FEED IT AS A QUERY INTO THE LLM FOR ANALYSIS. WE WILL EXPERIMENT WITH THIS STRAIGHTFORWARD APPROACH AFTER USING UTILITY
CODE/SOFTWARE TO EXTRACT THE TABLES IN STRUCTURED FORM AND THEN CREATE THE SENTENCES FROM THE TABLE FOR INPUT INTO THE
LLM.
4. CROSS CHECKING SUBMITTED DATA IN DIFFERENT FORMS: THE LLMS SHOULD BE GOOD AT IDENTIFYING DISCREPANCIES IN THE
DATA BECAUSE THIS WILL BE ENTIRELY TEXT BASED (ONCE WE SOLVE CHALLENGE
(3) WITH TURNING TABLES INTO TEXT), BUT HALLUCINATION WILL BE THE MAIN ISSUE TO EVALUATE.
WE RECOGNIZE THE CONSTRAINTS ON THIS PROJECT, PARTICULARLY THE REQUIREMENT THAT WE USE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE DATA, THAT THE
RESULTING MODELS BE COMPATIBLE WITH RUNNING LOCALLY ON FDA SERVERS INSIDE THE FIREWALL, AND THE NEED TO PUBLISH OUR
RESULTS COLLABORATIVE WITH FDA SCIENTISTS, IDEALLY WITH THE PUBLIC DATA SETS TO ENCOURAGE PROGRESS IN THIS FIELD. TO THAT
END, IT MAY MAKE SENSE TO USE PRECISIONFDA AS A PLATFORM FOR COMPETITIVE EVALUATIONS OF CAPABILITIESÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã¢Â‚¬Ï¿½ESPECIALLY
THOSE THAT SEEM DIFFICULT OR FOR WHICH THERE ARE MANY DIFFERENT APPROACHES.
WE ANTICIPATE THAT THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FDA WITH EXCELLENT INFORMATION ABOUT THE CURRENT CAPABILITIES OF LLMS FOR SUPPORT OF REGULATORY DECISION MAKING. ALTHOUGH OUR EFFORTS WILL FOCUS ON BE EVALUATION, THE LES

subawardee_name: MINNESOTA VETERANS MEDICAL RESEARCH AND EDUCATION FOUNDATION
subaward_description:
THE ABILITY TO RETURN TO PRE-INJURY ACTIVITIES, WHICH CAN INCLUDE A RETURN TO USING A VARIETY OF SHOES, IS AN IMPORTANT PART OF REHABILITATION AND REINTEGRATION FOLLOWING A LOWER EXTREMITY AMPUTATION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS STUDY IS TO ADDRESS FOOTWEAR CHALLENGES UNIQUE TO FEMALE PROSTHESIS USERS.  COMPARING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF DIFFERENT PATIENT CARE APPROACHES (I.E. FOOTWEAR AND PROSTHESIS COMBINATIONS) WILL HELP GUIDE PATIENT-CENTERED CLINICAL DECISION MAKING REGARDING THE PRESCRIPTION OF PROSTHETIC DEVICES. 

SIXTY FEMALE ACTIVE DUTY AND VETERAN LOWER EXTREMITY PROSTHESIS USERS WILL BE ENROLLED IN THE STUDY.  SURVEYS WILL BE DISTRIBUTED VIA MAIL TO IDENTIFY FOOTWEAR WORN AND DESIRED TO BE WORN BE FEMALES WITH LOWER EXTREMITY AMPUTATIONS.  THE SURVEY WILL FOCUS ON CHALLENGES AND LIMITATIONS FEMALE PROSTHESIS USERS FACE WITH WEARING AND USING DIFFERENT FOOTWEAR.  OUTCOMES OF THE SURVEY WILL BE USED TO IDENTIFY SPECIFIC PROSTHESIS AND FOOTWEAR COMBINATIONS.

THE MINNESOTA VETERANS MEDICAL RESEARCH AND EDUCATION FOUNDATION (MVMREF) WILL ASSIST SPECIFIC AIM 1 OF THE STUDY: DETERMINE LIMITATIONS IN WOMENÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S-SPECIFIC FOOTWEAR WITH PROSTHETIC FEET.  MVMREF, THROUGH A SUBAWARD ISSUED BY HJF, WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE SUBJECT ENROLLMENT AND DATA COLLECTION; AND DATA ANALYSIS AND DISTRIBUTION OF FINDINGS. 
IN YEAR 1, THE MVMREF WILL ASSIST WITH SURVEY REFINEMENT IN THE FIRST THREE MONTHS OF THE PROJECT. IN MONTHS 3-6, THE MVMREF WILL PREPARE A DATA ACCESS REQUEST TRACKER (DART) APPLICATION (AFTER IRB APPROVAL) TO RECEIVE NAMES AND ADDRESSES OF FEMALE VETERANS WITH LOWER-LIMB AMPUTATIONS.  DURING MONTHS 6-9, MVMREF WILL SEND SURVEYS TO THESE VETERANS TO GATHER INFORMATION ABOUT PREFERRED FOOTWEAR.  DURING THE REMAINDER OF YEAR 1, MVMRED WILL RECEIVE THE SURVEYS AND PAY RESEARCH SUBJECTS FOR THEIR PARTICIPATION.  SURVEYS WILL BE DE-IDENTIFIED AND SAVED IN PDF FORMAT ONTO A NETWORKED DRIVE BEHIND THE VAÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S FIREWALL.  WHEN COMPLETED, THE SURVEYS WILL BE MAILED TO THE CENTER FOR THE INTREPID USING AN APPROVED METHOD OF TRANSPORTATION OF VA DE-IDENTIFIED DATA.

IN YEAR 2, MVMREF WILL ASSIST WITH DATA ANALYSIS, RESULTS INTERPRETATION, AND DISSEMINATION. THE GROUP WILL USE THE STUDY RESULTS TO PROPOSE FUTURE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS.
PURCHASE EQUIPMENT TO UPGRADE FIREWALL.

subaward_description: THE RHO CREW TEAM WILL DEVELOP AND DEPLOY AN ACCESS-CONTROLLED WEB PORTAL CALLED RHOPORTAL FOR THE US CREW PROGRAM. RHOPORTAL WILL BE THE PRIMARY SOURCE FOR ALL MEETING AGENDAS AND MINUTES, CALENDARS, DIRECTORIES, AND DOCUMENTS FOR CREW STUDIES, ENSURING THAT EVERYONE CAN ALWAYS ACCESS THE MOST RECENT VERSIONS.    THE RHO CREW TEAM WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH UW-MADISON AND THE CREW INVESTIGATORS TO DEVELOP THE NECESSARY QUESTIONNAIRES, BIOSPECIMEN COLLECTION, PROCESSING, AND ANALYSIS FORMS, INFORMED CONSENT AND HIPAA FORMS, RECRUITMENT MATERIALS AND MANUALS OF OPERATIONS.    STUDY PERSONNEL INVOLVED IN STUDY CONDUCT ARE REQUIRED TO BE SUFFICIENTLY TRAINED TO CONDUCT THE STUDY IN ACCORDANCE WITH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON HARMONISATION (ICH) E6 GCP GUIDELINES; HOWEVER, THE SCOPE AND QUALITY OF STUDY TRAINING REQUIRED CANNOT BE ADEQUATELY ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH PASSIVE TRAINING TECHNIQUES THAT ARE NOT CAPABLE OF CONFIRMING COMPREHENSION. THEREFORE, RHOÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã¢Â€ŽÂ¢S TRAINING PROGRAM WILL INCLUDE A MIXED METHODOLOGY APPROACH, AN ACCOUNTABILITY COMPONENT AND PRE-RECORDED TRAINING MODULES TO ENSURE STANDARDIZATION OF THE TRAINING PROCESS. TO ASSESS TRAINING EFFECTIVENESS, SKILLS ARE EVALUATED WITH WRITTEN EXAMS, BY OBSERVATION, OR CERTIFICATION WITH A QUALIFIED TRAINER, AND BY ON-GOING QUALITY CONTROL EVALUATIONS.    WHENEVER NON-ENGLISH SPEAKING SUBJECTS ARE INVOLVED, RHO WILL ENSURE THAT ALL MATERIALS ARE PROPERLY TRANSLATED FOR ADMINISTRATION TO STUDY SUBJECTS, E.G., QUESTIONNAIRES. WE WILL UTILIZE CERTIFIED TRANSLATORS AT TRANSPERFECT, A VENDOR RHO HAS USED FOR OVER 10 YEARS ON NIH-FUNDED PROJECTS. TRANSPERFECT HAS THE CAPABILITY TO TRANSLATE MATERIALS IN OVER 100 DIFFERENT LANGUAGES.    ELECTRONIC DATA CAPTUREÃƑÂ¢Ã¢Â€ŠÂ¬Ã¢Â‚¬Ï¿½MEDIDATA RAVE  RHO WILL PROVIDE THE ELECTRONIC DATA CAPTURE SYSTEM FOR COLLECTING NEW DATA IN EXISTING COHORTS, BOTH FROM CURRENT STUDY PARTICIPANTS AND NEW ENROLLEES USING MEDIDATA RAVE, A COMMERCIAL, PASSWORD-PROTECTED, OFF-THE-SHELF EDC SYSTEM FROM MEDIDATA SOLUTIONS WORLDWIDE, AN INDUSTRY LEADER IN ELECTRONIC DATA CAPTURE AND MANAGEMENT. MEDIDATA IMPLEMENTS PHYSICAL, LOGICAL, AND OPERATIONAL SECURITY. THE PHYSICAL SECURITY INCLUDES PINS, SMARTCARDS, AND BIOMETRIC ACCESS CONTROLS; THE LOGICAL SECURITY INCLUDES  FIREWALLS, INTRUSION DETECTION, MALWARE SCANNERS, AND USER AUTHENTICATION CONTROLS. OPERATIONALLY, MEDIDATA HAS A STAFFED 24-7 NETWORK OPERATIONS CENTER TO MONITOR ITS SYSTEMS AND PERFORM REGULAR NETWORK AND APPLICATION PENETRATION TESTS.    HANDLING, TRANSPORT, STORAGE, ANALYSIS, AND INFORMATION PROCESSING AS REQUIRED FOR EACH CREW STUDY OR MODULE. RHO WILL USE RHOLAB TO MANAGE THE COLLECTION, SHIPPING, AND TRACKING OF SUCH SAMPLES. SPECIMENS WILL BE TRACKED USING A UNIQUE BARCODE AFFIXED TO EACH SAMPLE. COHORT SITE STAFF WILL USE THE SYSTEM TO REVIEW SAMPLE COLLECTION AND SHIPPING INFORMATION, RECORD INFORMATION REGARDING SAMPLES THAT ARE COLLECTED, DOCUMENT SHIPMENTS, AND GENERATE PACKING LISTS. AUTOMATED NOTIFICATIONS WILL BE SENT TO THE CENTRAL LABORATORY ONCE SAMPLES ARE MARKED AS SHIPPED. THE LABORATORY WILL USE THE SYSTEM TO DOCUMENT RECEIPT OF SHIPMENTS, NOTIFY THE RHO CREW TEAM AND FIELD STAFF OF SAMPLES RECEIVED AND THEIR DISPOSITION (E.G., MISSING, EXTRA, OR DAMAGED SAMPLES), AND TO SHIP SAMPLES TO OTHER LABORATORIES AND LONG-TERM STORAGE FACILITIES.    LABORATORY RESULTS DATA WILL BE TRANSFERRED FROM THE LABORATORIES TO RHO VIA THE RHO LABKEY SERVER. LABKEY SERVER IS AN OPEN SOURCE SOFTWARE SOLUTION PRODUCED BY LABKEY SOFTWARE, IN SEATTLE, WASHINGTON, (HTTP://WWW.LABKEY.COM/). IT HAS BEEN CONFIGURED TO PERFORM REAL-TIME RECONCILIATION OF MANUAL UPLOADS OF LABORATORY TO DAILY, AUTOMATED UPLOADS OF SPECIMEN TRACKING DATA FOR VISUALIZATION OF SAMPLE STATUS.    THE DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS USED IN THIS STUDY WILL EMPLOY SECURITY MEASURES TO PREVENT UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS TO THE SYSTEMS AS WELL AS TO DESIGNATE PRIVILEGES BASED UPON THE USER'S ROLE.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: Purpose: Recipients of the State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds (SLFRF) program will designate financial assistance to support urgent public health efforts to decrease spread of the coronavirus, replace lost revenue for vital public services and help retain jobs, support immediate economic stabilization for households and businesses, make necessary investments in water, sewer and broadband infrastructure, and cover the cost of other eligible activities. Activities to be performed: States (defined to include the District of Columbia), U.S. Territories (defined to include, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa), Tribes, Metropolitan cities, Counties, Consolidated Governments, and Non-entitlement units of local government (through States)(collectively "eligible entities") will receive payments from Treasury to use the funding for the eligible purposes outlined in the program statute, Treasury's implementing regulations, and guidance. End Goal/Expected Outcomes: Recipients of the SLFRF program will use funds to: (1) provide the necessary assistance for households, small businesses, nonprofits, and impacted industries, such as tourism, travel, and hospitality to respond to the COVID-19 public health emergency or its negative impacts; (2) be used to cover premium pay to eligible workers of the governments performing essential work during the COVID-19 pandemic or used to provide grants to eligible employers that have eligible workers who perform essential work; (3) provide government services, to the extent COVID-19 caused a reduction of revenues collected in the most recent full fiscal year of the government; or (4) make the necessary investments in water, sewer, or broadband infrastructure. Intended Beneficiaries: Essential workers, households, small businesses, nonprofits, the governments of the eligible entities, the general public, etc. Subrecipient Activities: Subrecipient activities are not known at this time. Recipient-specific information on use of funds was not available at the time of obligation. Please refer to https://home.treasury.gov/policy-issues/coronavirus/assistance-for-state-local-and-tribal-governments/state-and-local-fiscal-recovery-funds for updates on recipients' use of funds in the program.

subaward_description:
THE PURPOSE OF THE RESEARCH IS TO ALLOW COLLABORATION IN CHARACTERIZING PHYSIOLOGIC AND PATHOPHYSIOLOGIC SIGNATURES OF ILLNESS IN MONITORED PATIENTS, AND TO DEVELOP VALIDATED MATHEMATICAL AND STATISTICAL PREDICTIVE MODELS THAT ASSIST CLINICIANS IN EARLY DETECTION OF SUBACUTE POTENTIALLY CATASTROPHIC ILLNESSES. COLUMBIA WILL PROVIDE TO VIRGINIA COMPUTER FILES CONTAINING DEIDENTIFIED DATA FOR HUMAN SUBJECTS RESEARCH AND QUALITY IMPROVEMENT. THE DATA INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO CLINICAL INTONATION SUCH AS LABORATORY RESULTS AND BEDSIDE MONITOR INFORMATION SUCH AS DIGITIZED WAVEFORMS, VITAL SIGNS, AND VENTILATOR READINGS.THE DATA WILL BE PROVIDED IN AN OPEN BINARY FORMAT BUT WILL NOT INCLUDE HIPAA IDENTIFIERS. PATIENTS AND DATA WILL BE IDENTIFIEDUSING ONLY STUDY NUMBERS ANDCODED TIMESTAMPS. THELINK-CODING TABLEWILLBEHELDSECURELYATTHE SITE COLLECTING THE DATA, AND WILL NOT BE SHARED. COLUMBIA WILL ALSO PROVIDE TO VIRGINIA ALGORITHMS FOR ANALYSIS OF THESE DATA, AND HEREBY
GRANTS TO VIRGINIA ANON-EXCLUSIVE, PERPETUAL, PAID-UP, ROYALTY-FREE LICENSE TOINSTALL, OPERATE AND USE THEIR ANALYSIS ROUTINES.
VIRGINIA WILL PROVIDE TO COLUMBIA COMPUTER FILES CONTAINING DEIDENTIFIED DATA FOR HUMAN SUBJECTS RESEARCH AND QUALITY IMPROVEMENT. THE DATA INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO CLINICAL INFORMATION SUCH AS LABORATORY RESULTS AND BEDSIDE MONITOR INFORMATION SUCH AS DIGITIZED WAVEFORMS, VITAL SIGNS, AND VENTILATOR READINGS. THE DATA WILL BE PROVIDED IN AN OPEN BINARY FORMAT BUT WILL NOT INCLUDE HIPAAIDENTIFIERS. PATIENTS AND DATA WILL BE IDENTIFIED USING ONLY STUDY NUMBERS AND CODED TIMESTAMPS. THE LINK-CODING TABLE WILL BE HELD SECURELY AT THE SITE COLLECTING THE DATA, AND WILL NOT BE SHARED. VIRGINIA WILL ALSO PROVIDE TO COLUMBIA ALGORITHMS FOR ANALYSIS OF THESE DATA, AND HEREBY GRANTS TO COLUMBIA A NON-EXCLUSIVE, PERPETUAL, PAID-UP, ROYALTYFREE LICENSE TO INSTALL,OPERATE AND USETHEIR ANALYSIS ROUTINES.
THE RESEARCH PLAN WILL BE TO ANALYZE THESE DATA UNDER RESEARCH AND DATABASE PROTOCOLS APPROVED BY EACH SITE'S IRB AND USING CLINICALLY-SECURE FIREWALL-PROTECTED COMPUTERS.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: Domain-adaptive federated learning to develop machine learning models for predicting incident and progression of geographic atrophy - Abstract: Age-related macular degeneration (AMD) is one of the leading causes of severe vision loss. Early detection, prompt intervention, and reliable assessment of treatment outcomes are essential to prevent irreversible vision loss from advanced AMD stages such as geographic atrophy (GA). Patients at higher risk of progression to GA would benefit from more frequent follow up visits, low vision referrals, and administration of therapeutic interventions. Deep learning (DL) techniques have recently been applied to diagnose, classify, and understand the progression trends of GA. However, a major limitation of DL is the need for large amounts of well curated datasets from a diverse sub-population for robust diagnostic or prognostic performance. Due to the overfitting on training data, the model tends to perform badly on external data (less generalizability of the model). Moreover, efforts towards large public centralized datasets for DL research are hindered by significant barriers to data sharing, privacy concerns, costs of image de-identification, and controls over how data would be used. In this project, we aim to demonstrate the utility of novel federated DL approaches, which enable gaining insights collaboratively, e.g., in the form of a consensus model, without moving patient data beyond the firewalls of the institutions in which they reside. This novel paradigm of DL model training focuses on distributing the training of DL models across institutions instead of sharing patient data and only the model parameters are shared with a central server. We specifically seek to build robust risk models for predicting the occurrence and growth of GA. Four data cohorts from the Stanford University, University of Illinois Chicago (UIC), Wake Forest University (Wake Forest), and National Taiwan University (NTU) will be used to test the hypothesis that the prognostic accuracy of the GA risk models using federated approach is more robust than models built on single institutional datasets. Our first aim is to establish a federated learning (FL) framework for GA prediction utilizing longitudinal multi-modal imaging and patient meta-data from four independent institutions (training and independent testing dataset from Stanford, UIC, Wake Forest, and NTU). Key success criterion of the aim 1 study is to demonstrate a robust and secure FL framework for GA risk model training within the multi-institutional environment. The second aim is to integrate a novel adversarial domain alignment (ADA) technique into the FL framework to tackle domain shift caused by heterogeneous data distribution at different institutions. To improve data representation learning, and model transferability and generalizability across sub-population data, a novel self-supervised contrastive learning (CL) based methods will be employed within the FL framework. Key success criterion of the aim 2 study is to establish protocols for integrating domain alignment into FL framework and evaluate the FL- trained GA prediction models deployed on new and previously unseen clinical data. Clinical deployment of such AI prediction tools will facilitate identification of high-risk AMD patients as candidates for more frequent screening and earlier treatment, leading to better clinical outcomes.
subawardee_business_types: PRIVATE UNIVERSITY OR COLLEGE,NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION,BUSINESS OR ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description:
THIS PROJECT AIMS TO LEVERAGE MULTI-MODAL (IMAGING AND META-DATA) FEDERATED LEARNING (FL) FOR DEVELOPING ALGORITHMS TO PREDICT PROGRESSION OF GEOGRAPHIC ATROPHY (GA) IN PATIENTS WITH AGE-RELATED MACULAR DEGENERATION (AMD). SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS PROJECT WILL ESTABLISH THE FEASIBILITY OF USING NOVEL FEDERATED DEEP LEARNING (DL) APPROACHES IN WIDE-SPREAD DEPLOYMENT OF GA PREDICTION TOOLS. FEDERATED LEARNING ENABLES DATA TO REMAIN WITHIN INSTITUTIONS BUT SHARES MODEL PARAMETERS WITH A CENTRAL SERVER, SHIFTING THE PARADIGM ON DL RESEARCH ON AMD MANAGEMENT. 
AGE-RELATED MACULAR DEGENERATION (AMD) IS ONE OF THE LEADING CAUSES OF SEVERE VISION LOSS. EARLY DETECTION, PROMPT INTERVENTION, AND RELIABLE ASSESSMENT OF TREATMENT OUTCOMES ARE ESSENTIAL TO PREVENT IRREVERSIBLE VISUAL LOSS FROM ADVANCED AMD STAGES SUCH AS GEOGRAPHIC ATROPHY (GA). PATIENTS AT HIGHER RISK OF PROGRESSION TO GA OR GA GROWTH WOULD BENEFIT FROM MORE FREQUENT FOLLOW UP VISITS AND ADMINISTRATION OF THERAPEUTIC INTERVENTIONS ALONG WITH LOW VISION REFERRALS. ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AL) ALGORITHMS LIKE DEEP LEARNING (DL) HAVE RECENTLY BEEN APPLIED TO DIAGNOSE, CLASSIFY, AND UNDERSTAND THE PROGRESSION TRENDS OF AMD. A MAJOR LIMITATION OF DL, HOWEVER, IS THE NEED FOR LARGE AMOUNTS OF WELL CURATED DATASETS. OTHER LIMITATIONS INCLUDE OVERFITTING AND "BRITTLENESS" THAT CAN CAUSE MODEL PERFORMANCE TO DROP ON EXTERNAL DATA (LESS GENERALIZABILITY OF THE MODEL). MOREOVER, THERE ARE NUMEROUS BARRIERS TO BUILDING AND HOSTING THESE LARGE CENTRAL REPOSITORIES WITH MULTI-INSTITUTIONAL DATA REQUIRED FOR ROBUST DL, INCLUDING CONCERNS ABOUT DATA SHARING, REGULATORY ISSUES, PATIENT PRIVACY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY. IN THIS PROJECT, WE AIM TO DEMONSTRATE THE UTILITY OF NOVEL DISTRIBUTED/FEDERATED DL APPROACHES, WHICH ENABLE GAINING INSIGHTS COLLABORATIVELY, E.G., IN THE FORM OF A CONSENSUS MODEL, WITHOUT MOVING PATIENT DATA BEYOND THE FIREWALLS OF THE INSTITUTIONS IN WHICH THEY RESIDE. FOUR DATA COHORTS FROM THE STANFORD UNIVERSITY, UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS CHICAGO (UIC), WAKE FOREST ATRIUM EYE CENTER (WAKE FOREST UNIVERSITY HEALTH SCIENCES), AND NATIONAL TAIWAN UNIVERSITY (NTU) WILL BE USED TO VALIDATE THE HYPOTHESIS THAT THE PERFORMANCE OF THE RISK MODELS USING FEDERATED APPROACH IS MORE ROBUST THAN MODELS BUILT ON SINGLE INSTITUTIONAL DATASETS. 
PROJECT GOAL 
WE WILL TEST OUR HYPOTHESIS AND ACCOMPLISH OUR GOAL THROUGH THE FOLLOWING SPECIFIC AIMS: 
AIM 1: TO TEST THE FEASIBILITY OF DOMAIN ADAPTIVE FEDERATED APPROACHES FOR GA PREDICTION USING MULTI­MODAL AND LONGITUDINAL PATIENT DATA. IN THIS AIM, WE PROPOSE TO ESTABLISH AN FL FRAMEWORK FOR GA PREDICTION UTILIZING MULTI-MODAL IMAGING (OCT) AND PATIENT META-DATA FROM THREE INDEPENDENT INSTITUTIONS (STANFORD, UIC, AND WAKE FOREST UNIVERSITY; YEAR 1). WE WILL INTEGRATE A NOVEL ADVERSARIAL DOMAIN ALIGNMENT (ADA) TECHNIQUE INTO THE FL FRAMEWORK TO TACKLE DOMAIN SHIFT CAUSED BY HETEROGENEOUS DATA DISTRIBUTION AT DIFFERENT INSTITUTIONS. ADA CAN GENERALIZE THE DOMAIN VARIANT DATA INTO A COMMON SPACE OF TARGET DATA, ENHANCING THE GENERALIZABILITY AND ROBUSTNESS OF FL-TRAINED MODELS. WE WILL FURTHER EMPLOY SELF-SUPERVISED CONTRASTIVE LEARNING (CL) TO IMPROVE MODEL TRANSFERABILITY AND GENERALIZABILITY ACROSS SUB-POPULATION DATA. KEY SUCCESS CRITERION OF THE AIM 1 STUDY IS TO DEMONSTRATE A ROBUST, DOMAIN-ADAPTIVE, AND SECURE FEDERATED FRAMEWORK FOR GA RISK MODEL TRAINING WITHIN THREE INSTITUTIONS AND ESTABLISH PROTOCOLS FOR INTEGRATING DOMAIN ALIGNMENT INTO FL FRAMEWORKS.
AIM 2: TO EXPAND THE FL CONSORTIUM AND VALIDATE THE FL FRAMEWORKS FOR GA PREDICTION ON NEW RETROSPECTIVE CLINICAL DATA. IN THIS AIM, WE WILL EXPAND THE FL CONSORTIUM TO ONE NEW INSTITUTION (NTU) AND VALIDATE FL-TRAINED GA RISK PREDICTION MODELS ON DATA FROM THAT INSTITUTION (YEAR 2). THE FRAMEWORK AND GA PROGRESSION ALGORITHM WILL BE PACKAGED IN A SOFTWARE WITH EASY USER-INTERFACE THAT CAN BE DEPLOYED IN ANY NEW ADDITION TO THIS FL CONSORTIUM. KEY SUCCESS CRITERION OF TH
